45/* A global reference to myself is handy to make code more clear.
46 * Myself always points to server.cluster->myself, that is, the clusterNode
47 * that represents this node. */
48clusterNode *myself = NULL;

80/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
81 * Initialization
82 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
83
84/* Load the cluster config from 'filename'.
85 *
86 * If the file does not exist or is zero-length (this may happen because
87 * when we lock the nodes.conf file, we create a zero-length one for the
88 * sake of locking if it does not already exist), REDIS_ERR is returned.
89 * If the configuration was loaded from the file, REDIS_OK is returned. */
90int clusterLoadConfig(char *filename) {
91 FILE *fp = fopen(filename,"r");
92 struct stat sb;
93 char *line;
94 int maxline, j;
95
96 if (fp == NULL) {
97 if (errno == ENOENT) {
98 return REDIS_ERR;
99 } else {
100 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
101 "Loading the cluster node config from %s: %s",
102 filename, strerror(errno));
103 exit(1);
104 }
105 }
106
107 /* Check if the file is zero-length: if so return REDIS_ERR to signal
108 * we have to write the config. */
109 if (fstat(fileno(fp),&sb) != -1 && sb.st_size == 0) {
110 fclose(fp);
111 return REDIS_ERR;
112 }
113
114 /* Parse the file. Note that single lines of the cluster config file can
115 * be really long as they include all the hash slots of the node.
116 * This means in the worst possible case, half of the Redis slots will be
117 * present in a single line, possibly in importing or migrating state, so
118 * together with the node ID of the sender/receiver.
119 *
120 * To simplify we allocate 1024+REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS*128 bytes per line. */
121 maxline = 1024+REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS*128;
122 line = zmalloc(maxline);
123 while(fgets(line,maxline,fp) != NULL) {
124 int argc;
125 sds *argv;
126 clusterNode *n, *master;
127 char *p, *s;
128
129 /* Skip blank lines, they can be created either by users manually
130 * editing nodes.conf or by the config writing process if stopped
131 * before the truncate() call. */
132 if (line[0] == '\n') continue;
133
134 /* Split the line into arguments for processing. */
135 argv = sdssplitargs(line,&argc);
136 if (argv == NULL) goto fmterr;
137
138 /* Handle the special "vars" line. Don't pretend it is the last
139 * line even if it actually is when generated by Redis. */
140 if (strcasecmp(argv[0],"vars") == 0) {
141 for (j = 1; j < argc; j += 2) {
142 if (strcasecmp(argv[j],"currentEpoch") == 0) {
143 server.cluster->currentEpoch =
144 strtoull(argv[j+1],NULL,10);
145 } else if (strcasecmp(argv[j],"lastVoteEpoch") == 0) {
146 server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch =
147 strtoull(argv[j+1],NULL,10);
148 } else {
149 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
150 "Skipping unknown cluster config variable '%s'",
151 argv[j]);
152 }
153 }
154 sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
155 continue;
156 }
157
158 /* Regular config lines have at least eight fields */
159 if (argc < 8) goto fmterr;
160
161 /* Create this node if it does not exist */
162 n = clusterLookupNode(argv[0]);
163 if (!n) {
164 n = createClusterNode(argv[0],0);
165 clusterAddNode(n);
166 }
167 /* Address and port */
168 if ((p = strrchr(argv[1],':')) == NULL) goto fmterr;
169 *p = '\0';
170 memcpy(n->ip,argv[1],strlen(argv[1])+1);
171 n->port = atoi(p+1);
172
173 /* Parse flags */
174 p = s = argv[2];
175 while(p) {
176 p = strchr(s,',');
177 if (p) *p = '\0';
178 if (!strcasecmp(s,"myself")) {
179 redisAssert(server.cluster->myself == NULL);
180 myself = server.cluster->myself = n;
181 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_MYSELF;
182 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"master")) {
183 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_MASTER;
184 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"slave")) {
185 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_SLAVE;
186 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"fail?")) {
187 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_PFAIL;
188 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"fail")) {
189 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_FAIL;
190 n->fail_time = mstime();
191 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"handshake")) {
192 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE;
193 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"noaddr")) {
194 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_NOADDR;
195 } else if (!strcasecmp(s,"noflags")) {
196 /* nothing to do */
197 } else {
198 redisPanic("Unknown flag in redis cluster config file");
199 }
200 if (p) s = p+1;
201 }
202
203 /* Get master if any. Set the master and populate master's
204 * slave list. */
205 if (argv[3][0] != '-') {
206 master = clusterLookupNode(argv[3]);
207 if (!master) {
208 master = createClusterNode(argv[3],0);
209 clusterAddNode(master);
210 }
211 n->slaveof = master;
212 clusterNodeAddSlave(master,n);
213 }
214
215 /* Set ping sent / pong received timestamps */
216 if (atoi(argv[4])) n->ping_sent = mstime();
217 if (atoi(argv[5])) n->pong_received = mstime();
218
219 /* Set configEpoch for this node. */
220 n->configEpoch = strtoull(argv[6],NULL,10);
221
222 /* Populate hash slots served by this instance. */
223 for (j = 8; j < argc; j++) {
224 int start, stop;
225
226 if (argv[j][0] == '[') {
227 /* Here we handle migrating / importing slots */
228 int slot;
229 char direction;
230 clusterNode *cn;
231
232 p = strchr(argv[j],'-');
233 redisAssert(p != NULL);
234 *p = '\0';
235 direction = p[1]; /* Either '>' or '<' */
236 slot = atoi(argv[j]+1);
237 p += 3;
238 cn = clusterLookupNode(p);
239 if (!cn) {
240 cn = createClusterNode(p,0);
241 clusterAddNode(cn);
242 }
243 if (direction == '>') {
244 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = cn;
245 } else {
246 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = cn;
247 }
248 continue;
249 } else if ((p = strchr(argv[j],'-')) != NULL) {
250 *p = '\0';
251 start = atoi(argv[j]);
252 stop = atoi(p+1);
253 } else {
254 start = stop = atoi(argv[j]);
255 }
256 while(start <= stop) clusterAddSlot(n, start++);
257 }
258
259 sdsfreesplitres(argv,argc);
260 }
261 /* Config sanity check */
262 if (server.cluster->myself == NULL) goto fmterr;
263
264 zfree(line);
265 fclose(fp);
266
267 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,"Node configuration loaded, I'm %.40s", myself->name);
268
269 /* Something that should never happen: currentEpoch smaller than
270 * the max epoch found in the nodes configuration. However we handle this
271 * as some form of protection against manual editing of critical files. */
272 if (clusterGetMaxEpoch() > server.cluster->currentEpoch) {
273 server.cluster->currentEpoch = clusterGetMaxEpoch();
274 }
275 return REDIS_OK;
276
277fmterr:
278 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
279 "Unrecoverable error: corrupted cluster config file.");
280 zfree(line);
281 if (fp) fclose(fp);
282 exit(1);
283}
284
285/* Cluster node configuration is exactly the same as CLUSTER NODES output.
286 *
287 * This function writes the node config and returns 0, on error -1
288 * is returned.
289 *
290 * Note: we need to write the file in an atomic way from the point of view
291 * of the POSIX filesystem semantics, so that if the server is stopped
292 * or crashes during the write, we'll end with either the old file or the
293 * new one. Since we have the full payload to write available we can use
294 * a single write to write the whole file. If the pre-existing file was
295 * bigger we pad our payload with newlines that are anyway ignored and truncate
296 * the file afterward. */
297int clusterSaveConfig(int do_fsync) {
298 sds ci;
299 size_t content_size;
300 struct stat sb;
301 int fd;
302
303 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG;
304
305 /* Get the nodes description and concatenate our "vars" directive to
306 * save currentEpoch and lastVoteEpoch. */
307 ci = clusterGenNodesDescription(REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE);
308 ci = sdscatprintf(ci,"vars currentEpoch %llu lastVoteEpoch %llu\n",
309 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch,
310 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch);
311 content_size = sdslen(ci);
312
313 if ((fd = open(server.cluster_configfile,O_WRONLY|O_CREAT,0644))
314 == -1) goto err;
315
316 /* Pad the new payload if the existing file length is greater. */
317 if (fstat(fd,&sb) != -1) {
318 if (sb.st_size > (off_t)content_size) {
319 ci = sdsgrowzero(ci,sb.st_size);
320 memset(ci+content_size,'\n',sb.st_size-content_size);
321 }
322 }
323 if (write(fd,ci,sdslen(ci)) != (ssize_t)sdslen(ci)) goto err;
324 if (do_fsync) {
325 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG;
326 fsync(fd);
327 }
328
329 /* Truncate the file if needed to remove the final \n padding that
330 * is just garbage. */
331 if (content_size != sdslen(ci) && ftruncate(fd,content_size) == -1) {
332 /* ftruncate() failing is not a critical error. */
333 }
334 close(fd);
335 sdsfree(ci);
336 return 0;
337
338err:
339 if (fd != -1) close(fd);
340 sdsfree(ci);
341 return -1;
342}
343
344void clusterSaveConfigOrDie(int do_fsync) {
345 if (clusterSaveConfig(do_fsync) == -1) {
346 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Fatal: can't update cluster config file.");
347 exit(1);
348 }
349}
350
351/* Lock the cluster config using flock(), and leaks the file descritor used to
352 * acquire the lock so that the file will be locked forever.
353 *
354 * This works because we always update nodes.conf with a new version
355 * in-place, reopening the file, and writing to it in place (later adjusting
356 * the length with ftruncate()).
357 *
358 * On success REDIS_OK is returned, otherwise an error is logged and
359 * the function returns REDIS_ERR to signal a lock was not acquired. */
360int clusterLockConfig(char *filename) {
361 /* To lock it, we need to open the file in a way it is created if
362 * it does not exist, otherwise there is a race condition with other
363 * processes. */
364 int fd = open(filename,O_WRONLY|O_CREAT,0644);
365 if (fd == -1) {
366 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
367 "Can't open %s in order to acquire a lock: %s",
368 filename, strerror(errno));
369 return REDIS_ERR;
370 }
371
372 if (flock(fd,LOCK_EX|LOCK_NB) == -1) {
373 if (errno == EWOULDBLOCK) {
374 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
375 "Sorry, the cluster configuration file %s is already used "
376 "by a different Redis Cluster node. Please make sure that "
377 "different nodes use different cluster configuration "
378 "files.", filename);
379 } else {
380 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
381 "Impossible to lock %s: %s", filename, strerror(errno));
382 }
383 close(fd);
384 return REDIS_ERR;
385 }
386 /* Lock acquired: leak the 'fd' by not closing it, so that we'll retain the
387 * lock to the file as long as the process exists. */
388 return REDIS_OK;
389}
390
391void clusterInit(void) {
392 int saveconf = 0;
393
394 server.cluster = zmalloc(sizeof(clusterState));
395 server.cluster->myself = NULL;
396 server.cluster->currentEpoch = 0;
397 server.cluster->state = REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL;
398 server.cluster->size = 1;
399 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep = 0;
400 server.cluster->nodes = dictCreate(&clusterNodesDictType,NULL);
401 server.cluster->nodes_black_list =
402 dictCreate(&clusterNodesBlackListDictType,NULL);
403 server.cluster->failover_auth_time = 0;
404 server.cluster->failover_auth_count = 0;
405 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = 0;
406 server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch = 0;
407 server.cluster->cant_failover_reason = REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_NONE;
408 server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch = 0;
409 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent = 0;
410 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received = 0;
411 memset(server.cluster->slots,0, sizeof(server.cluster->slots));
412 clusterCloseAllSlots();
413
414 /* Lock the cluster config file to make sure every node uses
415 * its own nodes.conf. */
416 if (clusterLockConfig(server.cluster_configfile) == REDIS_ERR)
417 exit(1);
418
419 /* Load or create a new nodes configuration. */
420 if (clusterLoadConfig(server.cluster_configfile) == REDIS_ERR) {
421 /* No configuration found. We will just use the random name provided
422 * by the createClusterNode() function. */
423 myself = server.cluster->myself =
424 createClusterNode(NULL,REDIS_NODE_MYSELF|REDIS_NODE_MASTER);
425 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,"No cluster configuration found, I'm %.40s",
426 myself->name);
427 clusterAddNode(myself);
428 saveconf = 1;
429 }
430 if (saveconf) clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
431
432 /* We need a listening TCP port for our cluster messaging needs. */
433 server.cfd_count = 0;
434
435 /* Port sanity check II
436 * The other handshake port check is triggered too late to stop
437 * us from trying to use a too-high cluster port number. */
438 if (server.port > (65535-REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR)) {
439 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING, "Redis port number too high. "
440 "Cluster communication port is 10,000 port "
441 "numbers higher than your Redis port. "
442 "Your Redis port number must be "
443 "lower than 55535.");
444 exit(1);
445 }
446
447 if (listenToPort(server.port+REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR,
448 server.cfd,&server.cfd_count) == REDIS_ERR)
449 {
450 exit(1);
451 } else {
452 int j;
453
454 for (j = 0; j < server.cfd_count; j++) {
455 if (aeCreateFileEvent(server.el, server.cfd[j], AE_READABLE,
456 clusterAcceptHandler, NULL) == AE_ERR)
457 redisPanic("Unrecoverable error creating Redis Cluster "
458 "file event.");
459 }
460 }
461
462 /* The slots -> keys map is a sorted set. Init it. */
463 server.cluster->slots_to_keys = zslCreate();
464
465 /* Set myself->port to my listening port, we'll just need to discover
466 * the IP address via MEET messages. */
467 myself->port = server.port;
468
469 server.cluster->mf_end = 0;
470 resetManualFailover();
471}
472
473/* Reset a node performing a soft or hard reset:
474 *
475 * 1) All other nodes are forget.
476 * 2) All the assigned / open slots are released.
477 * 3) If the node is a slave, it turns into a master.
478 * 5) Only for hard reset: a new Node ID is generated.
479 * 6) Only for hard reset: currentEpoch and configEpoch are set to 0.
480 * 7) The new configuration is saved and the cluster state updated.
481 * 8) If the node was a slave, the whole data set is flushed away. */
482void clusterReset(int hard) {
483 dictIterator *di;
484 dictEntry *de;
485 int j;
486
487 /* Turn into master. */
488 if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) {
489 clusterSetNodeAsMaster(myself);
490 replicationUnsetMaster();
491 emptyDb(NULL);
492 }
493
494 /* Close slots, reset manual failover state. */
495 clusterCloseAllSlots();
496 resetManualFailover();
497
498 /* Unassign all the slots. */
499 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) clusterDelSlot(j);
500
501 /* Forget all the nodes, but myself. */
502 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
503 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
504 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
505
506 if (node == myself) continue;
507 clusterDelNode(node);
508 }
509 dictReleaseIterator(di);
510
511 /* Hard reset only: set epochs to 0, change node ID. */
512 if (hard) {
513 sds oldname;
514
515 server.cluster->currentEpoch = 0;
516 server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch = 0;
517 myself->configEpoch = 0;
518 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING, "configEpoch set to 0 via CLUSTER RESET HARD");
519
520 /* To change the Node ID we need to remove the old name from the
521 * nodes table, change the ID, and re-add back with new name. */
522 oldname = sdsnewlen(myself->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
523 dictDelete(server.cluster->nodes,oldname);
524 sdsfree(oldname);
525 getRandomHexChars(myself->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
526 clusterAddNode(myself);
527 }
528
529 /* Make sure to persist the new config and update the state. */
530 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
531 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
532 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
533}
534
535/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
536 * CLUSTER communication link
537 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
538
539clusterLink *createClusterLink(clusterNode *node) {
540 clusterLink *link = zmalloc(sizeof(*link));
541 link->ctime = mstime();
542 link->sndbuf = sdsempty();
543 link->rcvbuf = sdsempty();
544 link->node = node;
545 link->fd = -1;
546 return link;
547}
548
549/* Free a cluster link, but does not free the associated node of course.
550 * This function will just make sure that the original node associated
551 * with this link will have the 'link' field set to NULL. */
552void freeClusterLink(clusterLink *link) {
553 if (link->fd != -1) {
554 aeDeleteFileEvent(server.el, link->fd, AE_WRITABLE);
555 aeDeleteFileEvent(server.el, link->fd, AE_READABLE);
556 }
557 sdsfree(link->sndbuf);
558 sdsfree(link->rcvbuf);
559 if (link->node)
560 link->node->link = NULL;
561 close(link->fd);
562 zfree(link);
563}
564
565#define MAX_CLUSTER_ACCEPTS_PER_CALL 1000
566void clusterAcceptHandler(aeEventLoop *el, int fd, void *privdata, int mask) {
567 int cport, cfd;
568 int max = MAX_CLUSTER_ACCEPTS_PER_CALL;
569 char cip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
570 clusterLink *link;
571 REDIS_NOTUSED(el);
572 REDIS_NOTUSED(mask);
573 REDIS_NOTUSED(privdata);
574
575 /* If the server is starting up, don't accept cluster connections:
576 * UPDATE messages may interact with the database content. */
577 if (server.masterhost == NULL && server.loading) return;
578
579 while(max--) {
580 cfd = anetTcpAccept(server.neterr, fd, cip, sizeof(cip), &cport);
581 if (cfd == ANET_ERR) {
582 if (errno != EWOULDBLOCK)
583 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
584 "Error accepting cluster node: %s", server.neterr);
585 return;
586 }
587 anetNonBlock(NULL,cfd);
588 anetEnableTcpNoDelay(NULL,cfd);
589
590 /* Use non-blocking I/O for cluster messages. */
591 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,"Accepted cluster node %s:%d", cip, cport);
592 /* Create a link object we use to handle the connection.
593 * It gets passed to the readable handler when data is available.
594 * Initiallly the link->node pointer is set to NULL as we don't know
595 * which node is, but the right node is references once we know the
596 * node identity. */
597 link = createClusterLink(NULL);
598 link->fd = cfd;
599 aeCreateFileEvent(server.el,cfd,AE_READABLE,clusterReadHandler,link);
600 }
601}
602
603/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
604 * Key space handling
605 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
606
607/* We have 16384 hash slots. The hash slot of a given key is obtained
608 * as the least significant 14 bits of the crc16 of the key.
609 *
610 * However if the key contains the {...} pattern, only the part between
611 * { and } is hashed. This may be useful in the future to force certain
612 * keys to be in the same node (assuming no resharding is in progress). */
613unsigned int keyHashSlot(char *key, int keylen) {
614 int s, e; /* start-end indexes of { and } */
615
616 for (s = 0; s < keylen; s++)
617 if (key[s] == '{') break;
618
619 /* No '{' ? Hash the whole key. This is the base case. */
620 if (s == keylen) return crc16(key,keylen) & 0x3FFF;
621
622 /* '{' found? Check if we have the corresponding '}'. */
623 for (e = s+1; e < keylen; e++)
624 if (key[e] == '}') break;
625
626 /* No '}' or nothing betweeen {} ? Hash the whole key. */
627 if (e == keylen || e == s+1) return crc16(key,keylen) & 0x3FFF;
628
629 /* If we are here there is both a { and a } on its right. Hash
630 * what is in the middle between { and }. */
631 return crc16(key+s+1,e-s-1) & 0x3FFF;
632}
633
634/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
635 * CLUSTER node API
636 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
637
638/* Create a new cluster node, with the specified flags.
639 * If "nodename" is NULL this is considered a first handshake and a random
640 * node name is assigned to this node (it will be fixed later when we'll
641 * receive the first pong).
642 *
643 * The node is created and returned to the user, but it is not automatically
644 * added to the nodes hash table. */
645clusterNode *createClusterNode(char *nodename, int flags) {
646 clusterNode *node = zmalloc(sizeof(*node));
647
648 if (nodename)
649 memcpy(node->name, nodename, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
650 else
651 getRandomHexChars(node->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
652 node->ctime = mstime();
653 node->configEpoch = 0;
654 node->flags = flags;
655 memset(node->slots,0,sizeof(node->slots));
656 node->numslots = 0;
657 node->numslaves = 0;
658 node->slaves = NULL;
659 node->slaveof = NULL;
660 node->ping_sent = node->pong_received = 0;
661 node->fail_time = 0;
662 node->link = NULL;
663 memset(node->ip,0,sizeof(node->ip));
664 node->port = 0;
665 node->fail_reports = listCreate();
666 node->voted_time = 0;
667 node->repl_offset_time = 0;
668 node->repl_offset = 0;
669 listSetFreeMethod(node->fail_reports,zfree);
670 return node;
671}
672
673/* This function is called every time we get a failure report from a node.
674 * The side effect is to populate the fail_reports list (or to update
675 * the timestamp of an existing report).
676 *
677 * 'failing' is the node that is in failure state according to the
678 * 'sender' node.
679 *
680 * The function returns 0 if it just updates a timestamp of an existing
681 * failure report from the same sender. 1 is returned if a new failure
682 * report is created. */
683int clusterNodeAddFailureReport(clusterNode *failing, clusterNode *sender) {
684 list *l = failing->fail_reports;
685 listNode *ln;
686 listIter li;
687 clusterNodeFailReport *fr;
688
689 /* If a failure report from the same sender already exists, just update
690 * the timestamp. */
691 listRewind(l,&li);
692 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
693 fr = ln->value;
694 if (fr->node == sender) {
695 fr->time = mstime();
696 return 0;
697 }
698 }
699
700 /* Otherwise create a new report. */
701 fr = zmalloc(sizeof(*fr));
702 fr->node = sender;
703 fr->time = mstime();
704 listAddNodeTail(l,fr);
705 return 1;
706}
707
708/* Remove failure reports that are too old, where too old means reasonably
709 * older than the global node timeout. Note that anyway for a node to be
710 * flagged as FAIL we need to have a local PFAIL state that is at least
711 * older than the global node timeout, so we don't just trust the number
712 * of failure reports from other nodes. */
713void clusterNodeCleanupFailureReports(clusterNode *node) {
714 list *l = node->fail_reports;
715 listNode *ln;
716 listIter li;
717 clusterNodeFailReport *fr;
718 mstime_t maxtime = server.cluster_node_timeout *
719 REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL_REPORT_VALIDITY_MULT;
720 mstime_t now = mstime();
721
722 listRewind(l,&li);
723 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
724 fr = ln->value;
725 if (now - fr->time > maxtime) listDelNode(l,ln);
726 }
727}
728
729/* Remove the failing report for 'node' if it was previously considered
730 * failing by 'sender'. This function is called when a node informs us via
731 * gossip that a node is OK from its point of view (no FAIL or PFAIL flags).
732 *
733 * Note that this function is called relatively often as it gets called even
734 * when there are no nodes failing, and is O(N), however when the cluster is
735 * fine the failure reports list is empty so the function runs in constant
736 * time.
737 *
738 * The function returns 1 if the failure report was found and removed.
739 * Otherwise 0 is returned. */
740int clusterNodeDelFailureReport(clusterNode *node, clusterNode *sender) {
741 list *l = node->fail_reports;
742 listNode *ln;
743 listIter li;
744 clusterNodeFailReport *fr;
745
746 /* Search for a failure report from this sender. */
747 listRewind(l,&li);
748 while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
749 fr = ln->value;
750 if (fr->node == sender) break;
751 }
752 if (!ln) return 0; /* No failure report from this sender. */
753
754 /* Remove the failure report. */
755 listDelNode(l,ln);
756 clusterNodeCleanupFailureReports(node);
757 return 1;
758}
759
760/* Return the number of external nodes that believe 'node' is failing,
761 * not including this node, that may have a PFAIL or FAIL state for this
762 * node as well. */
763int clusterNodeFailureReportsCount(clusterNode *node) {
764 clusterNodeCleanupFailureReports(node);
765 return listLength(node->fail_reports);
766}
767
768int clusterNodeRemoveSlave(clusterNode *master, clusterNode *slave) {
769 int j;
770
771 for (j = 0; j < master->numslaves; j++) {
772 if (master->slaves[j] == slave) {
773 if ((j+1) < master->numslaves) {
774 int remaining_slaves = (master->numslaves - j) - 1;
775 memmove(master->slaves+j,master->slaves+(j+1),
776 (sizeof(*master->slaves) * remaining_slaves));
777 }
778 master->numslaves--;
779 return REDIS_OK;
780 }
781 }
782 return REDIS_ERR;
783}
784
785int clusterNodeAddSlave(clusterNode *master, clusterNode *slave) {
786 int j;
787
788 /* If it's already a slave, don't add it again. */
789 for (j = 0; j < master->numslaves; j++)
790 if (master->slaves[j] == slave) return REDIS_ERR;
791 master->slaves = zrealloc(master->slaves,
792 sizeof(clusterNode*)*(master->numslaves+1));
793 master->slaves[master->numslaves] = slave;
794 master->numslaves++;
795 return REDIS_OK;
796}
797
798void clusterNodeResetSlaves(clusterNode *n) {
799 zfree(n->slaves);
800 n->numslaves = 0;
801 n->slaves = NULL;
802}
803
804int clusterCountNonFailingSlaves(clusterNode *n) {
805 int j, okslaves = 0;
806
807 for (j = 0; j < n->numslaves; j++)
808 if (!nodeFailed(n->slaves[j])) okslaves++;
809 return okslaves;
810}
811
812/* Low level cleanup of the node structure. Only called by clusterDelNode(). */
813void freeClusterNode(clusterNode *n) {
814 sds nodename;
815 int j;
816
817 /* If the node is a master with associated slaves, we have to set
818 * all the slaves->slaveof fields to NULL (unknown). */
819 if (nodeIsMaster(n)) {
820 for (j = 0; j < n->numslaves; j++)
821 n->slaves[j]->slaveof = NULL;
822 }
823
824 /* Remove this node from the list of slaves of its master. */
825 if (nodeIsSlave(n) && n->slaveof) clusterNodeRemoveSlave(n->slaveof,n);
826
827 /* Unlink from the set of nodes. */
828 nodename = sdsnewlen(n->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
829 redisAssert(dictDelete(server.cluster->nodes,nodename) == DICT_OK);
830 sdsfree(nodename);
831
832 /* Release link and associated data structures. */
833 if (n->link) freeClusterLink(n->link);
834 listRelease(n->fail_reports);
835 zfree(n->slaves);
836 zfree(n);
837}
838
839/* Add a node to the nodes hash table */
840int clusterAddNode(clusterNode *node) {
841 int retval;
842
843 retval = dictAdd(server.cluster->nodes,
844 sdsnewlen(node->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN), node);
845 return (retval == DICT_OK) ? REDIS_OK : REDIS_ERR;
846}
847
848/* Remove a node from the cluster. The functio performs the high level
849 * cleanup, calling freeClusterNode() for the low level cleanup.
850 * Here we do the following:
851 *
852 * 1) Mark all the slots handled by it as unassigned.
853 * 2) Remove all the failure reports sent by this node and referenced by
854 * other nodes.
855 * 3) Free the node with freeClusterNode() that will in turn remove it
856 * from the hash table and from the list of slaves of its master, if
857 * it is a slave node.
858 */
859void clusterDelNode(clusterNode *delnode) {
860 int j;
861 dictIterator *di;
862 dictEntry *de;
863
864 /* 1) Mark slots as unassigned. */
865 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
866 if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] == delnode)
867 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] = NULL;
868 if (server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j] == delnode)
869 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j] = NULL;
870 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == delnode)
871 clusterDelSlot(j);
872 }
873
874 /* 2) Remove failure reports. */
875 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
876 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
877 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
878
879 if (node == delnode) continue;
880 clusterNodeDelFailureReport(node,delnode);
881 }
882 dictReleaseIterator(di);
883
884 /* 3) Free the node, unlinking it from the cluster. */
885 freeClusterNode(delnode);
886}
887
888/* Node lookup by name */
889clusterNode *clusterLookupNode(char *name) {
890 sds s = sdsnewlen(name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
891 dictEntry *de;
892
893 de = dictFind(server.cluster->nodes,s);
894 sdsfree(s);
895 if (de == NULL) return NULL;
896 return dictGetVal(de);
897}
898
899/* This is only used after the handshake. When we connect a given IP/PORT
900 * as a result of CLUSTER MEET we don't have the node name yet, so we
901 * pick a random one, and will fix it when we receive the PONG request using
902 * this function. */
903void clusterRenameNode(clusterNode *node, char *newname) {
904 int retval;
905 sds s = sdsnewlen(node->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
906
907 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"Renaming node %.40s into %.40s",
908 node->name, newname);
909 retval = dictDelete(server.cluster->nodes, s);
910 sdsfree(s);
911 redisAssert(retval == DICT_OK);
912 memcpy(node->name, newname, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
913 clusterAddNode(node);
914}
915
916/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
917 * CLUSTER config epoch handling
918 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
919
920/* Return the greatest configEpoch found in the cluster, or the current
921 * epoch if greater than any node configEpoch. */
922uint64_t clusterGetMaxEpoch(void) {
923 uint64_t max = 0;
924 dictIterator *di;
925 dictEntry *de;
926
927 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
928 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
929 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
930 if (node->configEpoch > max) max = node->configEpoch;
931 }
932 dictReleaseIterator(di);
933 if (max < server.cluster->currentEpoch) max = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
934 return max;
935}
936
937/* If this node epoch is zero or is not already the greatest across the
938 * cluster (from the POV of the local configuration), this function will:
939 *
940 * 1) Generate a new config epoch increment the current epoch.
941 * 2) Assign the new epoch to this node, WITHOUT any consensus.
942 * 3) Persist the configuration on disk before sending packets with the
943 * new configuration.
944 *
945 * If the new config epoch is generated and assigend, REDIS_OK is returned,
946 * otherwise REDIS_ERR is returned (since the node has already the greatest
947 * configuration around) and no operation is performed.
948 *
949 * Important note: this function violates the principle that config epochs
950 * should be generated with consensus and should be unique across the cluster.
951 * However Redis Cluster uses this auto-generated new config epochs in two
952 * cases:
953 *
954 * 1) When slots are closed after importing. Otherwise resharding would be
955 * too exansive.
956 * 2) When CLUSTER FAILOVER is called with options that force a slave to
957 * failover its master even if there is not master majority able to
958 * create a new configuration epoch.
959 *
960 * Redis Cluster does not explode using this function, even in the case of
961 * a collision between this node and another node, generating the same
962 * configuration epoch unilaterally, because the config epoch conflict
963 * resolution algorithm will eventually move colliding nodes to different
964 * config epochs. However usign this function may violate the "last failover
965 * wins" rule, so should only be used with care. */
966int clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus(void) {
967 uint64_t maxEpoch = clusterGetMaxEpoch();
968
969 if (myself->configEpoch == 0 ||
970 myself->configEpoch != maxEpoch)
971 {
972 server.cluster->currentEpoch++;
973 myself->configEpoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
974 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
975 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
976 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
977 "New configEpoch set to %llu",
978 (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
979 return REDIS_OK;
980 } else {
981 return REDIS_ERR;
982 }
983}
984
985/* This function is called when this node is a master, and we receive from
986 * another master a configuration epoch that is equal to our configuration
987 * epoch.
988 *
989 * BACKGROUND
990 *
991 * It is not possible that different slaves get the same config
992 * epoch during a failover election, because the slaves need to get voted
993 * by a majority. However when we perform a manual resharding of the cluster
994 * the node will assign a configuration epoch to itself without to ask
995 * for agreement. Usually resharding happens when the cluster is working well
996 * and is supervised by the sysadmin, however it is possible for a failover
997 * to happen exactly while the node we are resharding a slot to assigns itself
998 * a new configuration epoch, but before it is able to propagate it.
999 *
1000 * So technically it is possible in this condition that two nodes end with
1001 * the same configuration epoch.
1002 *
1003 * Another possibility is that there are bugs in the implementation causing
1004 * this to happen.
1005 *
1006 * Moreover when a new cluster is created, all the nodes start with the same
1007 * configEpoch. This collision resolution code allows nodes to automatically
1008 * end with a different configEpoch at startup automatically.
1009 *
1010 * In all the cases, we want a mechanism that resolves this issue automatically
1011 * as a safeguard. The same configuration epoch for masters serving different
1012 * set of slots is not harmful, but it is if the nodes end serving the same
1013 * slots for some reason (manual errors or software bugs) without a proper
1014 * failover procedure.
1015 *
1016 * In general we want a system that eventually always ends with different
1017 * masters having different configuration epochs whatever happened, since
1018 * nothign is worse than a split-brain condition in a distributed system.
1019 *
1020 * BEHAVIOR
1021 *
1022 * When this function gets called, what happens is that if this node
1023 * has the lexicographically smaller Node ID compared to the other node
1024 * with the conflicting epoch (the 'sender' node), it will assign itself
1025 * the greatest configuration epoch currently detected among nodes plus 1.
1026 *
1027 * This means that even if there are multiple nodes colliding, the node
1028 * with the greatest Node ID never moves forward, so eventually all the nodes
1029 * end with a different configuration epoch.
1030 */
1031void clusterHandleConfigEpochCollision(clusterNode *sender) {
1032 /* Prerequisites: nodes have the same configEpoch and are both masters. */
1033 if (sender->configEpoch != myself->configEpoch ||
1034 !nodeIsMaster(sender) || !nodeIsMaster(myself)) return;
1035 /* Don't act if the colliding node has a smaller Node ID. */
1036 if (memcmp(sender->name,myself->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN) <= 0) return;
1037 /* Get the next ID available at the best of this node knowledge. */
1038 server.cluster->currentEpoch++;
1039 myself->configEpoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
1040 clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
1041 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1042 "WARNING: configEpoch collision with node %.40s."
1043 " configEpoch set to %llu",
1044 sender->name,
1045 (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
1046}
1047
1048/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1049 * CLUSTER nodes blacklist
1050 *
1051 * The nodes blacklist is just a way to ensure that a given node with a given
1052 * Node ID is not readded before some time elapsed (this time is specified
1053 * in seconds in REDIS_CLUSTER_BLACKLIST_TTL).
1054 *
1055 * This is useful when we want to remove a node from the cluster completely:
1056 * when CLUSTER FORGET is called, it also puts the node into the blacklist so
1057 * that even if we receive gossip messages from other nodes that still remember
1058 * about the node we want to remove, we don't re-add it before some time.
1059 *
1060 * Currently the REDIS_CLUSTER_BLACKLIST_TTL is set to 1 minute, this means
1061 * that redis-trib has 60 seconds to send CLUSTER FORGET messages to nodes
1062 * in the cluster without dealing with the problem of other nodes re-adding
1063 * back the node to nodes we already sent the FORGET command to.
1064 *
1065 * The data structure used is a hash table with an sds string representing
1066 * the node ID as key, and the time when it is ok to re-add the node as
1067 * value.
1068 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1069
1070#define REDIS_CLUSTER_BLACKLIST_TTL 60 /* 1 minute. */
1071
1072
1073/* Before of the addNode() or Exists() operations we always remove expired
1074 * entries from the black list. This is an O(N) operation but it is not a
1075 * problem since add / exists operations are called very infrequently and
1076 * the hash table is supposed to contain very little elements at max.
1077 * However without the cleanup during long uptimes and with some automated
1078 * node add/removal procedures, entries could accumulate. */
1079void clusterBlacklistCleanup(void) {
1080 dictIterator *di;
1081 dictEntry *de;
1082
1083 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes_black_list);
1084 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1085 int64_t expire = dictGetUnsignedIntegerVal(de);
1086
1087 if (expire < server.unixtime)
1088 dictDelete(server.cluster->nodes_black_list,dictGetKey(de));
1089 }
1090 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1091}
1092
1093/* Cleanup the blacklist and add a new node ID to the black list. */
1094void clusterBlacklistAddNode(clusterNode *node) {
1095 dictEntry *de;
1096 sds id = sdsnewlen(node->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
1097
1098 clusterBlacklistCleanup();
1099 if (dictAdd(server.cluster->nodes_black_list,id,NULL) == DICT_OK) {
1100 /* If the key was added, duplicate the sds string representation of
1101 * the key for the next lookup. We'll free it at the end. */
1102 id = sdsdup(id);
1103 }
1104 de = dictFind(server.cluster->nodes_black_list,id);
1105 dictSetUnsignedIntegerVal(de,time(NULL)+REDIS_CLUSTER_BLACKLIST_TTL);
1106 sdsfree(id);
1107}
1108
1109/* Return non-zero if the specified node ID exists in the blacklist.
1110 * You don't need to pass an sds string here, any pointer to 40 bytes
1111 * will work. */
1112int clusterBlacklistExists(char *nodeid) {
1113 sds id = sdsnewlen(nodeid,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
1114 int retval;
1115
1116 clusterBlacklistCleanup();
1117 retval = dictFind(server.cluster->nodes_black_list,id) != NULL;
1118 sdsfree(id);
1119 return retval;
1120}
1121
1122/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
1123 * CLUSTER messages exchange - PING/PONG and gossip
1124 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1125
1126/* This function checks if a given node should be marked as FAIL.
1127 * It happens if the following conditions are met:
1128 *
1129 * 1) We received enough failure reports from other master nodes via gossip.
1130 * Enough means that the majority of the masters signaled the node is
1131 * down recently.
1132 * 2) We believe this node is in PFAIL state.
1133 *
1134 * If a failure is detected we also inform the whole cluster about this
1135 * event trying to force every other node to set the FAIL flag for the node.
1136 *
1137 * Note that the form of agreement used here is weak, as we collect the majority
1138 * of masters state during some time, and even if we force agreement by
1139 * propagating the FAIL message, because of partitions we may not reach every
1140 * node. However:
1141 *
1142 * 1) Either we reach the majority and eventually the FAIL state will propagate
1143 * to all the cluster.
1144 * 2) Or there is no majority so no slave promotion will be authorized and the
1145 * FAIL flag will be cleared after some time.
1146 */
1147void markNodeAsFailingIfNeeded(clusterNode *node) {
1148 int failures;
1149 int needed_quorum = (server.cluster->size / 2) + 1;
1150
1151 if (!nodeTimedOut(node)) return; /* We can reach it. */
1152 if (nodeFailed(node)) return; /* Already FAILing. */
1153
1154 failures = clusterNodeFailureReportsCount(node);
1155 /* Also count myself as a voter if I'm a master. */
1156 if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) failures++;
1157 if (failures < needed_quorum) return; /* No weak agreement from masters. */
1158
1159 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,
1160 "Marking node %.40s as failing (quorum reached).", node->name);
1161
1162 /* Mark the node as failing. */
1163 node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_PFAIL;
1164 node->flags |= REDIS_NODE_FAIL;
1165 node->fail_time = mstime();
1166
1167 /* Broadcast the failing node name to everybody, forcing all the other
1168 * reachable nodes to flag the node as FAIL. */
1169 if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) clusterSendFail(node->name);
1170 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1171}
1172
1173/* This function is called only if a node is marked as FAIL, but we are able
1174 * to reach it again. It checks if there are the conditions to undo the FAIL
1175 * state. */
1176void clearNodeFailureIfNeeded(clusterNode *node) {
1177 mstime_t now = mstime();
1178
1179 redisAssert(nodeFailed(node));
1180
1181 /* For slaves we always clear the FAIL flag if we can contact the
1182 * node again. */
1183 if (nodeIsSlave(node) || node->numslots == 0) {
1184 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,
1185 "Clear FAIL state for node %.40s: %s is reachable again.",
1186 node->name,
1187 nodeIsSlave(node) ? "slave" : "master without slots");
1188 node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_FAIL;
1189 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1190 }
1191
1192 /* If it is a master and...
1193 * 1) The FAIL state is old enough.
1194 * 2) It is yet serving slots from our point of view (not failed over).
1195 * Apparently no one is going to fix these slots, clear the FAIL flag. */
1196 if (nodeIsMaster(node) && node->numslots > 0 &&
1197 (now - node->fail_time) >
1198 (server.cluster_node_timeout * REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL_UNDO_TIME_MULT))
1199 {
1200 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,
1201 "Clear FAIL state for node %.40s: is reachable again and nobody is serving its slots after some time.",
1202 node->name);
1203 node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_FAIL;
1204 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1205 }
1206}
1207
1208/* Return true if we already have a node in HANDSHAKE state matching the
1209 * specified ip address and port number. This function is used in order to
1210 * avoid adding a new handshake node for the same address multiple times. */
1211int clusterHandshakeInProgress(char *ip, int port) {
1212 dictIterator *di;
1213 dictEntry *de;
1214
1215 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
1216 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1217 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
1218
1219 if (!nodeInHandshake(node)) continue;
1220 if (!strcasecmp(node->ip,ip) && node->port == port) break;
1221 }
1222 dictReleaseIterator(di);
1223 return de != NULL;
1224}
1225
1226/* Start an handshake with the specified address if there is not one
1227 * already in progress. Returns non-zero if the handshake was actually
1228 * started. On error zero is returned and errno is set to one of the
1229 * following values:
1230 *
1231 * EAGAIN - There is already an handshake in progress for this address.
1232 * EINVAL - IP or port are not valid. */
1233int clusterStartHandshake(char *ip, int port) {
1234 clusterNode *n;
1235 char norm_ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
1236 struct sockaddr_storage sa;
1237
1238 /* IP sanity check */
1239 if (inet_pton(AF_INET,ip,
1240 &(((struct sockaddr_in *)&sa)->sin_addr)))
1241 {
1242 sa.ss_family = AF_INET;
1243 } else if (inet_pton(AF_INET6,ip,
1244 &(((struct sockaddr_in6 *)&sa)->sin6_addr)))
1245 {
1246 sa.ss_family = AF_INET6;
1247 } else {
1248 errno = EINVAL;
1249 return 0;
1250 }
1251
1252 /* Port sanity check */
1253 if (port <= 0 || port > (65535-REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR)) {
1254 errno = EINVAL;
1255 return 0;
1256 }
1257
1258 /* Set norm_ip as the normalized string representation of the node
1259 * IP address. */
1260 memset(norm_ip,0,REDIS_IP_STR_LEN);
1261 if (sa.ss_family == AF_INET)
1262 inet_ntop(AF_INET,
1263 (void*)&(((struct sockaddr_in *)&sa)->sin_addr),
1264 norm_ip,REDIS_IP_STR_LEN);
1265 else
1266 inet_ntop(AF_INET6,
1267 (void*)&(((struct sockaddr_in6 *)&sa)->sin6_addr),
1268 norm_ip,REDIS_IP_STR_LEN);
1269
1270 if (clusterHandshakeInProgress(norm_ip,port)) {
1271 errno = EAGAIN;
1272 return 0;
1273 }
1274
1275 /* Add the node with a random address (NULL as first argument to
1276 * createClusterNode()). Everything will be fixed during the
1277 * handshake. */
1278 n = createClusterNode(NULL,REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE|REDIS_NODE_MEET);
1279 memcpy(n->ip,norm_ip,sizeof(n->ip));
1280 n->port = port;
1281 clusterAddNode(n);
1282 return 1;
1283}
1284
1285/* Process the gossip section of PING or PONG packets.
1286 * Note that this function assumes that the packet is already sanity-checked
1287 * by the caller, not in the content of the gossip section, but in the
1288 * length. */
1289void clusterProcessGossipSection(clusterMsg *hdr, clusterLink *link) {
1290 uint16_t count = ntohs(hdr->count);
1291 clusterMsgDataGossip *g = (clusterMsgDataGossip*) hdr->data.ping.gossip;
1292 clusterNode *sender = link->node ? link->node : clusterLookupNode(hdr->sender);
1293
1294 while(count--) {
1295 uint16_t flags = ntohs(g->flags);
1296 clusterNode *node;
1297 sds ci;
1298
1299 ci = representRedisNodeFlags(sdsempty(), flags);
1300 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"GOSSIP %.40s %s:%d %s",
1301 g->nodename,
1302 g->ip,
1303 ntohs(g->port),
1304 ci);
1305 sdsfree(ci);
1306
1307 /* Update our state accordingly to the gossip sections */
1308 node = clusterLookupNode(g->nodename);
1309 if (node) {
1310 /* We already know this node.
1311 Handle failure reports, only when the sender is a master. */
1312 if (sender && nodeIsMaster(sender) && node != myself) {
1313 if (flags & (REDIS_NODE_FAIL|REDIS_NODE_PFAIL)) {
1314 if (clusterNodeAddFailureReport(node,sender)) {
1315 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1316 "Node %.40s reported node %.40s as not reachable.",
1317 sender->name, node->name);
1318 }
1319 markNodeAsFailingIfNeeded(node);
1320 } else {
1321 if (clusterNodeDelFailureReport(node,sender)) {
1322 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1323 "Node %.40s reported node %.40s is back online.",
1324 sender->name, node->name);
1325 }
1326 }
1327 }
1328
1329 /* If we already know this node, but it is not reachable, and
1330 * we see a different address in the gossip section, start an
1331 * handshake with the (possibly) new address: this will result
1332 * into a node address update if the handshake will be
1333 * successful. */
1334 if (node->flags & (REDIS_NODE_FAIL|REDIS_NODE_PFAIL) &&
1335 (strcasecmp(node->ip,g->ip) || node->port != ntohs(g->port)))
1336 {
1337 clusterStartHandshake(g->ip,ntohs(g->port));
1338 }
1339 } else {
1340 /* If it's not in NOADDR state and we don't have it, we
1341 * start a handshake process against this IP/PORT pairs.
1342 *
1343 * Note that we require that the sender of this gossip message
1344 * is a well known node in our cluster, otherwise we risk
1345 * joining another cluster. */
1346 if (sender &&
1347 !(flags & REDIS_NODE_NOADDR) &&
1348 !clusterBlacklistExists(g->nodename))
1349 {
1350 clusterStartHandshake(g->ip,ntohs(g->port));
1351 }
1352 }
1353
1354 /* Next node */
1355 g++;
1356 }
1357}
1358
1359/* IP -> string conversion. 'buf' is supposed to at least be 46 bytes. */
1360void nodeIp2String(char *buf, clusterLink *link) {
1361 anetPeerToString(link->fd, buf, REDIS_IP_STR_LEN, NULL);
1362}
1363
1364/* Update the node address to the IP address that can be extracted
1365 * from link->fd, and at the specified port.
1366 * Also disconnect the node link so that we'll connect again to the new
1367 * address.
1368 *
1369 * If the ip/port pair are already correct no operation is performed at
1370 * all.
1371 *
1372 * The function returns 0 if the node address is still the same,
1373 * otherwise 1 is returned. */
1374int nodeUpdateAddressIfNeeded(clusterNode *node, clusterLink *link, int port) {
1375 char ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN] = {0};
1376
1377 /* We don't proceed if the link is the same as the sender link, as this
1378 * function is designed to see if the node link is consistent with the
1379 * symmetric link that is used to receive PINGs from the node.
1380 *
1381 * As a side effect this function never frees the passed 'link', so
1382 * it is safe to call during packet processing. */
1383 if (link == node->link) return 0;
1384
1385 nodeIp2String(ip,link);
1386 if (node->port == port && strcmp(ip,node->ip) == 0) return 0;
1387
1388 /* IP / port is different, update it. */
1389 memcpy(node->ip,ip,sizeof(ip));
1390 node->port = port;
1391 if (node->link) freeClusterLink(node->link);
1392 node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_NOADDR;
1393 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Address updated for node %.40s, now %s:%d",
1394 node->name, node->ip, node->port);
1395
1396 /* Check if this is our master and we have to change the
1397 * replication target as well. */
1398 if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof == node)
1399 replicationSetMaster(node->ip, node->port);
1400 return 1;
1401}
1402
1403/* Reconfigure the specified node 'n' as a master. This function is called when
1404 * a node that we believed to be a slave is now acting as master in order to
1405 * update the state of the node. */
1406void clusterSetNodeAsMaster(clusterNode *n) {
1407 if (nodeIsMaster(n)) return;
1408
1409 if (n->slaveof) clusterNodeRemoveSlave(n->slaveof,n);
1410 n->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_SLAVE;
1411 n->flags |= REDIS_NODE_MASTER;
1412 n->slaveof = NULL;
1413
1414 /* Update config and state. */
1415 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1416 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1417}
1418
1419/* This function is called when we receive a master configuration via a
1420 * PING, PONG or UPDATE packet. What we receive is a node, a configEpoch of the
1421 * node, and the set of slots claimed under this configEpoch.
1422 *
1423 * What we do is to rebind the slots with newer configuration compared to our
1424 * local configuration, and if needed, we turn ourself into a replica of the
1425 * node (see the function comments for more info).
1426 *
1427 * The 'sender' is the node for which we received a configuration update.
1428 * Sometimes it is not actually the "Sender" of the information, like in the case
1429 * we receive the info via an UPDATE packet. */
1430void clusterUpdateSlotsConfigWith(clusterNode *sender, uint64_t senderConfigEpoch, unsigned char *slots) {
1431 int j;
1432 clusterNode *curmaster, *newmaster = NULL;
1433 /* The dirty slots list is a list of slots for which we lose the ownership
1434 * while having still keys inside. This usually happens after a failover
1435 * or after a manual cluster reconfiguration operated by the admin.
1436 *
1437 * If the update message is not able to demote a master to slave (in this
1438 * case we'll resync with the master updating the whole key space), we
1439 * need to delete all the keys in the slots we lost ownership. */
1440 uint16_t dirty_slots[REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS];
1441 int dirty_slots_count = 0;
1442
1443 /* Here we set curmaster to this node or the node this node
1444 * replicates to if it's a slave. In the for loop we are
1445 * interested to check if slots are taken away from curmaster. */
1446 curmaster = nodeIsMaster(myself) ? myself : myself->slaveof;
1447
1448 if (sender == myself) {
1449 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Discarding UPDATE message about myself.");
1450 return;
1451 }
1452
1453 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
1454 if (bitmapTestBit(slots,j)) {
1455 /* The slot is already bound to the sender of this message. */
1456 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == sender) continue;
1457
1458 /* The slot is in importing state, it should be modified only
1459 * manually via redis-trib (example: a resharding is in progress
1460 * and the migrating side slot was already closed and is advertising
1461 * a new config. We still want the slot to be closed manually). */
1462 if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j]) continue;
1463
1464 /* We rebind the slot to the new node claiming it if:
1465 * 1) The slot was unassigned or the new node claims it with a
1466 * greater configEpoch.
1467 * 2) We are not currently importing the slot. */
1468 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL ||
1469 server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch < senderConfigEpoch)
1470 {
1471 /* Was this slot mine, and still contains keys? Mark it as
1472 * a dirty slot. */
1473 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == myself &&
1474 countKeysInSlot(j) &&
1475 sender != myself)
1476 {
1477 dirty_slots[dirty_slots_count] = j;
1478 dirty_slots_count++;
1479 }
1480
1481 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == curmaster)
1482 newmaster = sender;
1483 clusterDelSlot(j);
1484 clusterAddSlot(sender,j);
1485 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1486 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
1487 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
1488 }
1489 }
1490 }
1491
1492 /* If at least one slot was reassigned from a node to another node
1493 * with a greater configEpoch, it is possible that:
1494 * 1) We are a master left without slots. This means that we were
1495 * failed over and we should turn into a replica of the new
1496 * master.
1497 * 2) We are a slave and our master is left without slots. We need
1498 * to replicate to the new slots owner. */
1499 if (newmaster && curmaster->numslots == 0) {
1500 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
1501 "Configuration change detected. Reconfiguring myself "
1502 "as a replica of %.40s", sender->name);
1503 clusterSetMaster(sender);
1504 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1505 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
1506 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
1507 } else if (dirty_slots_count) {
1508 /* If we are here, we received an update message which removed
1509 * ownership for certain slots we still have keys about, but still
1510 * we are serving some slots, so this master node was not demoted to
1511 * a slave.
1512 *
1513 * In order to maintain a consistent state between keys and slots
1514 * we need to remove all the keys from the slots we lost. */
1515 for (j = 0; j < dirty_slots_count; j++)
1516 delKeysInSlot(dirty_slots[j]);
1517 }
1518}
1519
1520/* When this function is called, there is a packet to process starting
1521 * at node->rcvbuf. Releasing the buffer is up to the caller, so this
1522 * function should just handle the higher level stuff of processing the
1523 * packet, modifying the cluster state if needed.
1524 *
1525 * The function returns 1 if the link is still valid after the packet
1526 * was processed, otherwise 0 if the link was freed since the packet
1527 * processing lead to some inconsistency error (for instance a PONG
1528 * received from the wrong sender ID). */
1529int clusterProcessPacket(clusterLink *link) {
1530 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) link->rcvbuf;
1531 uint32_t totlen = ntohl(hdr->totlen);
1532 uint16_t type = ntohs(hdr->type);
1533 uint16_t flags = ntohs(hdr->flags);
1534 uint64_t senderCurrentEpoch = 0, senderConfigEpoch = 0;
1535 clusterNode *sender;
1536
1537 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received++;
1538 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"--- Processing packet of type %d, %lu bytes",
1539 type, (unsigned long) totlen);
1540
1541 /* Perform sanity checks */
1542 if (totlen < 16) return 1; /* At least signature, version, totlen, count. */
1543 if (ntohs(hdr->ver) != CLUSTER_PROTO_VER)
1544 return 1; /* Can't handle versions other than the current one.*/
1545 if (totlen > sdslen(link->rcvbuf)) return 1;
1546 if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING || type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG ||
1547 type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET)
1548 {
1549 uint16_t count = ntohs(hdr->count);
1550 uint32_t explen; /* expected length of this packet */
1551
1552 explen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
1553 explen += (sizeof(clusterMsgDataGossip)*count);
1554 if (totlen != explen) return 1;
1555 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAIL) {
1556 uint32_t explen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
1557
1558 explen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataFail);
1559 if (totlen != explen) return 1;
1560 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PUBLISH) {
1561 uint32_t explen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
1562
1563 explen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataPublish) -
1564 8 +
1565 ntohl(hdr->data.publish.msg.channel_len) +
1566 ntohl(hdr->data.publish.msg.message_len);
1567 if (totlen != explen) return 1;
1568 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_REQUEST ||
1569 type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK ||
1570 type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MFSTART)
1571 {
1572 uint32_t explen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
1573
1574 if (totlen != explen) return 1;
1575 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE) {
1576 uint32_t explen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
1577
1578 explen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataUpdate);
1579 if (totlen != explen) return 1;
1580 }
1581
1582 /* Check if the sender is a known node. */
1583 sender = clusterLookupNode(hdr->sender);
1584 if (sender && !nodeInHandshake(sender)) {
1585 /* Update our curretEpoch if we see a newer epoch in the cluster. */
1586 senderCurrentEpoch = ntohu64(hdr->currentEpoch);
1587 senderConfigEpoch = ntohu64(hdr->configEpoch);
1588 if (senderCurrentEpoch > server.cluster->currentEpoch)
1589 server.cluster->currentEpoch = senderCurrentEpoch;
1590 /* Update the sender configEpoch if it is publishing a newer one. */
1591 if (senderConfigEpoch > sender->configEpoch) {
1592 sender->configEpoch = senderConfigEpoch;
1593 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1594 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
1595 }
1596 /* Update the replication offset info for this node. */
1597 sender->repl_offset = ntohu64(hdr->offset);
1598 sender->repl_offset_time = mstime();
1599 /* If we are a slave performing a manual failover and our master
1600 * sent its offset while already paused, populate the MF state. */
1601 if (server.cluster->mf_end &&
1602 nodeIsSlave(myself) &&
1603 myself->slaveof == sender &&
1604 hdr->mflags[0] & CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_PAUSED &&
1605 server.cluster->mf_master_offset == 0)
1606 {
1607 server.cluster->mf_master_offset = sender->repl_offset;
1608 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
1609 "Received replication offset for paused "
1610 "master manual failover: %lld",
1611 server.cluster->mf_master_offset);
1612 }
1613 }
1614
1615 /* Initial processing of PING and MEET requests replying with a PONG. */
1616 if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING || type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET) {
1617 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"Ping packet received: %p", (void*)link->node);
1618
1619 /* We use incoming MEET messages in order to set the address
1620 * for 'myself', since only other cluster nodes will send us
1621 * MEET messagses on handshakes, when the cluster joins, or
1622 * later if we changed address, and those nodes will use our
1623 * official address to connect to us. So by obtaining this address
1624 * from the socket is a simple way to discover / update our own
1625 * address in the cluster without it being hardcoded in the config.
1626 *
1627 * However if we don't have an address at all, we update the address
1628 * even with a normal PING packet. If it's wrong it will be fixed
1629 * by MEET later. */
1630 if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET || myself->ip[0] == '\0') {
1631 char ip[REDIS_IP_STR_LEN];
1632
1633 if (anetSockName(link->fd,ip,sizeof(ip),NULL) != -1 &&
1634 strcmp(ip,myself->ip))
1635 {
1636 memcpy(myself->ip,ip,REDIS_IP_STR_LEN);
1637 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"IP address for this node updated to %s",
1638 myself->ip);
1639 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1640 }
1641 }
1642
1643 /* Add this node if it is new for us and the msg type is MEET.
1644 * In this stage we don't try to add the node with the right
1645 * flags, slaveof pointer, and so forth, as this details will be
1646 * resolved when we'll receive PONGs from the node. */
1647 if (!sender && type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET) {
1648 clusterNode *node;
1649
1650 node = createClusterNode(NULL,REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE);
1651 nodeIp2String(node->ip,link);
1652 node->port = ntohs(hdr->port);
1653 clusterAddNode(node);
1654 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1655 }
1656
1657 /* If this is a MEET packet from an unknown node, we still process
1658 * the gossip section here since we have to trust the sender because
1659 * of the message type. */
1660 if (!sender && type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET)
1661 clusterProcessGossipSection(hdr,link);
1662
1663 /* Anyway reply with a PONG */
1664 clusterSendPing(link,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG);
1665 }
1666
1667 /* PING, PONG, MEET: process config information. */
1668 if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING || type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG ||
1669 type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET)
1670 {
1671 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"%s packet received: %p",
1672 type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING ? "ping" : "pong",
1673 (void*)link->node);
1674 if (link->node) {
1675 if (nodeInHandshake(link->node)) {
1676 /* If we already have this node, try to change the
1677 * IP/port of the node with the new one. */
1678 if (sender) {
1679 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1680 "Handshake: we already know node %.40s, "
1681 "updating the address if needed.", sender->name);
1682 if (nodeUpdateAddressIfNeeded(sender,link,ntohs(hdr->port)))
1683 {
1684 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1685 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1686 }
1687 /* Free this node as we already have it. This will
1688 * cause the link to be freed as well. */
1689 clusterDelNode(link->node);
1690 return 0;
1691 }
1692
1693 /* First thing to do is replacing the random name with the
1694 * right node name if this was a handshake stage. */
1695 clusterRenameNode(link->node, hdr->sender);
1696 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"Handshake with node %.40s completed.",
1697 link->node->name);
1698 link->node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE;
1699 link->node->flags |= flags&(REDIS_NODE_MASTER|REDIS_NODE_SLAVE);
1700 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1701 } else if (memcmp(link->node->name,hdr->sender,
1702 REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN) != 0)
1703 {
1704 /* If the reply has a non matching node ID we
1705 * disconnect this node and set it as not having an associated
1706 * address. */
1707 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"PONG contains mismatching sender ID");
1708 link->node->flags |= REDIS_NODE_NOADDR;
1709 link->node->ip[0] = '\0';
1710 link->node->port = 0;
1711 freeClusterLink(link);
1712 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1713 return 0;
1714 }
1715 }
1716
1717 /* Update the node address if it changed. */
1718 if (sender && type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING &&
1719 !nodeInHandshake(sender) &&
1720 nodeUpdateAddressIfNeeded(sender,link,ntohs(hdr->port)))
1721 {
1722 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1723 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1724 }
1725
1726 /* Update our info about the node */
1727 if (link->node && type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG) {
1728 link->node->pong_received = mstime();
1729 link->node->ping_sent = 0;
1730
1731 /* The PFAIL condition can be reversed without external
1732 * help if it is momentary (that is, if it does not
1733 * turn into a FAIL state).
1734 *
1735 * The FAIL condition is also reversible under specific
1736 * conditions detected by clearNodeFailureIfNeeded(). */
1737 if (nodeTimedOut(link->node)) {
1738 link->node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_PFAIL;
1739 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1740 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1741 } else if (nodeFailed(link->node)) {
1742 clearNodeFailureIfNeeded(link->node);
1743 }
1744 }
1745
1746 /* Check for role switch: slave -> master or master -> slave. */
1747 if (sender) {
1748 if (!memcmp(hdr->slaveof,REDIS_NODE_NULL_NAME,
1749 sizeof(hdr->slaveof)))
1750 {
1751 /* Node is a master. */
1752 clusterSetNodeAsMaster(sender);
1753 } else {
1754 /* Node is a slave. */
1755 clusterNode *master = clusterLookupNode(hdr->slaveof);
1756
1757 if (nodeIsMaster(sender)) {
1758 /* Master turned into a slave! Reconfigure the node. */
1759 clusterDelNodeSlots(sender);
1760 sender->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_MASTER;
1761 sender->flags |= REDIS_NODE_SLAVE;
1762
1763 /* Remove the list of slaves from the node. */
1764 if (sender->numslaves) clusterNodeResetSlaves(sender);
1765
1766 /* Update config and state. */
1767 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1768 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1769 }
1770
1771 /* Master node changed for this slave? */
1772 if (master && sender->slaveof != master) {
1773 if (sender->slaveof)
1774 clusterNodeRemoveSlave(sender->slaveof,sender);
1775 clusterNodeAddSlave(master,sender);
1776 sender->slaveof = master;
1777
1778 /* Update config. */
1779 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
1780 }
1781 }
1782 }
1783
1784 /* Update our info about served slots.
1785 *
1786 * Note: this MUST happen after we update the master/slave state
1787 * so that REDIS_NODE_MASTER flag will be set. */
1788
1789 /* Many checks are only needed if the set of served slots this
1790 * instance claims is different compared to the set of slots we have
1791 * for it. Check this ASAP to avoid other computational expansive
1792 * checks later. */
1793 clusterNode *sender_master = NULL; /* Sender or its master if slave. */
1794 int dirty_slots = 0; /* Sender claimed slots don't match my view? */
1795
1796 if (sender) {
1797 sender_master = nodeIsMaster(sender) ? sender : sender->slaveof;
1798 if (sender_master) {
1799 dirty_slots = memcmp(sender_master->slots,
1800 hdr->myslots,sizeof(hdr->myslots)) != 0;
1801 }
1802 }
1803
1804 /* 1) If the sender of the message is a master, and we detected that
1805 * the set of slots it claims changed, scan the slots to see if we
1806 * need to update our configuration. */
1807 if (sender && nodeIsMaster(sender) && dirty_slots)
1808 clusterUpdateSlotsConfigWith(sender,senderConfigEpoch,hdr->myslots);
1809
1810 /* 2) We also check for the reverse condition, that is, the sender
1811 * claims to serve slots we know are served by a master with a
1812 * greater configEpoch. If this happens we inform the sender.
1813 *
1814 * This is useful because sometimes after a partition heals, a
1815 * reappearing master may be the last one to claim a given set of
1816 * hash slots, but with a configuration that other instances know to
1817 * be deprecated. Example:
1818 *
1819 * A and B are master and slave for slots 1,2,3.
1820 * A is partitioned away, B gets promoted.
1821 * B is partitioned away, and A returns available.
1822 *
1823 * Usually B would PING A publishing its set of served slots and its
1824 * configEpoch, but because of the partition B can't inform A of the
1825 * new configuration, so other nodes that have an updated table must
1826 * do it. In this way A will stop to act as a master (or can try to
1827 * failover if there are the conditions to win the election). */
1828 if (sender && dirty_slots) {
1829 int j;
1830
1831 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
1832 if (bitmapTestBit(hdr->myslots,j)) {
1833 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == sender ||
1834 server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL) continue;
1835 if (server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch >
1836 senderConfigEpoch)
1837 {
1838 redisLog(REDIS_VERBOSE,
1839 "Node %.40s has old slots configuration, sending "
1840 "an UPDATE message about %.40s",
1841 sender->name, server.cluster->slots[j]->name);
1842 clusterSendUpdate(sender->link,
1843 server.cluster->slots[j]);
1844
1845 /* TODO: instead of exiting the loop send every other
1846 * UPDATE packet for other nodes that are the new owner
1847 * of sender's slots. */
1848 break;
1849 }
1850 }
1851 }
1852 }
1853
1854 /* If our config epoch collides with the sender's try to fix
1855 * the problem. */
1856 if (sender &&
1857 nodeIsMaster(myself) && nodeIsMaster(sender) &&
1858 senderConfigEpoch == myself->configEpoch)
1859 {
1860 clusterHandleConfigEpochCollision(sender);
1861 }
1862
1863 /* Get info from the gossip section */
1864 if (sender) clusterProcessGossipSection(hdr,link);
1865 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAIL) {
1866 clusterNode *failing;
1867
1868 if (sender) {
1869 failing = clusterLookupNode(hdr->data.fail.about.nodename);
1870 if (failing &&
1871 !(failing->flags & (REDIS_NODE_FAIL|REDIS_NODE_MYSELF)))
1872 {
1873 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,
1874 "FAIL message received from %.40s about %.40s",
1875 hdr->sender, hdr->data.fail.about.nodename);
1876 failing->flags |= REDIS_NODE_FAIL;
1877 failing->fail_time = mstime();
1878 failing->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_PFAIL;
1879 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1880 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
1881 }
1882 } else {
1883 redisLog(REDIS_NOTICE,
1884 "Ignoring FAIL message from unknown node %.40s about %.40s",
1885 hdr->sender, hdr->data.fail.about.nodename);
1886 }
1887 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PUBLISH) {
1888 robj *channel, *message;
1889 uint32_t channel_len, message_len;
1890
1891 /* Don't bother creating useless objects if there are no
1892 * Pub/Sub subscribers. */
1893 if (dictSize(server.pubsub_channels) ||
1894 listLength(server.pubsub_patterns))
1895 {
1896 channel_len = ntohl(hdr->data.publish.msg.channel_len);
1897 message_len = ntohl(hdr->data.publish.msg.message_len);
1898 channel = createStringObject(
1899 (char*)hdr->data.publish.msg.bulk_data,channel_len);
1900 message = createStringObject(
1901 (char*)hdr->data.publish.msg.bulk_data+channel_len,
1902 message_len);
1903 pubsubPublishMessage(channel,message);
1904 decrRefCount(channel);
1905 decrRefCount(message);
1906 }
1907 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_REQUEST) {
1908 if (!sender) return 1; /* We don't know that node. */
1909 clusterSendFailoverAuthIfNeeded(sender,hdr);
1910 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK) {
1911 if (!sender) return 1; /* We don't know that node. */
1912 /* We consider this vote only if the sender is a master serving
1913 * a non zero number of slots, and its currentEpoch is greater or
1914 * equal to epoch where this node started the election. */
1915 if (nodeIsMaster(sender) && sender->numslots > 0 &&
1916 senderCurrentEpoch >= server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch)
1917 {
1918 server.cluster->failover_auth_count++;
1919 /* Maybe we reached a quorum here, set a flag to make sure
1920 * we check ASAP. */
1921 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_HANDLE_FAILOVER);
1922 }
1923 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MFSTART) {
1924 /* This message is acceptable only if I'm a master and the sender
1925 * is one of my slaves. */
1926 if (!sender || sender->slaveof != myself) return 1;
1927 /* Manual failover requested from slaves. Initialize the state
1928 * accordingly. */
1929 resetManualFailover();
1930 server.cluster->mf_end = mstime() + REDIS_CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT;
1931 server.cluster->mf_slave = sender;
1932 pauseClients(mstime()+(REDIS_CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT*2));
1933 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Manual failover requested by slave %.40s.",
1934 sender->name);
1935 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE) {
1936 clusterNode *n; /* The node the update is about. */
1937 uint64_t reportedConfigEpoch =
1938 ntohu64(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.configEpoch);
1939
1940 if (!sender) return 1; /* We don't know the sender. */
1941 n = clusterLookupNode(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.nodename);
1942 if (!n) return 1; /* We don't know the reported node. */
1943 if (n->configEpoch >= reportedConfigEpoch) return 1; /* Nothing new. */
1944
1945 /* If in our current config the node is a slave, set it as a master. */
1946 if (nodeIsSlave(n)) clusterSetNodeAsMaster(n);
1947
1948 /* Update the node's configEpoch. */
1949 n->configEpoch = reportedConfigEpoch;
1950 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
1951 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
1952
1953 /* Check the bitmap of served slots and update our
1954 * config accordingly. */
1955 clusterUpdateSlotsConfigWith(n,reportedConfigEpoch,
1956 hdr->data.update.nodecfg.slots);
1957 } else {
1958 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Received unknown packet type: %d", type);
1959 }
1960 return 1;
1961}
1962
1963/* This function is called when we detect the link with this node is lost.
1964 We set the node as no longer connected. The Cluster Cron will detect
1965 this connection and will try to get it connected again.
1966
1967 Instead if the node is a temporary node used to accept a query, we
1968 completely free the node on error. */
1969void handleLinkIOError(clusterLink *link) {
1970 freeClusterLink(link);
1971}
1972
1973/* Send data. This is handled using a trivial send buffer that gets
1974 * consumed by write(). We don't try to optimize this for speed too much
1975 * as this is a very low traffic channel. */
1976void clusterWriteHandler(aeEventLoop *el, int fd, void *privdata, int mask) {
1977 clusterLink *link = (clusterLink*) privdata;
1978 ssize_t nwritten;
1979 REDIS_NOTUSED(el);
1980 REDIS_NOTUSED(mask);
1981
1982 nwritten = write(fd, link->sndbuf, sdslen(link->sndbuf));
1983 if (nwritten <= 0) {
1984 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"I/O error writing to node link: %s",
1985 strerror(errno));
1986 handleLinkIOError(link);
1987 return;
1988 }
1989 sdsrange(link->sndbuf,nwritten,-1);
1990 if (sdslen(link->sndbuf) == 0)
1991 aeDeleteFileEvent(server.el, link->fd, AE_WRITABLE);
1992}
1993
1994/* Read data. Try to read the first field of the header first to check the
1995 * full length of the packet. When a whole packet is in memory this function
1996 * will call the function to process the packet. And so forth. */
1997void clusterReadHandler(aeEventLoop *el, int fd, void *privdata, int mask) {
1998 char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
1999 ssize_t nread;
2000 clusterMsg *hdr;
2001 clusterLink *link = (clusterLink*) privdata;
2002 unsigned int readlen, rcvbuflen;
2003 REDIS_NOTUSED(el);
2004 REDIS_NOTUSED(mask);
2005
2006 while(1) { /* Read as long as there is data to read. */
2007 rcvbuflen = sdslen(link->rcvbuf);
2008 if (rcvbuflen < 8) {
2009 /* First, obtain the first 8 bytes to get the full message
2010 * length. */
2011 readlen = 8 - rcvbuflen;
2012 } else {
2013 /* Finally read the full message. */
2014 hdr = (clusterMsg*) link->rcvbuf;
2015 if (rcvbuflen == 8) {
2016 /* Perform some sanity check on the message signature
2017 * and length. */
2018 if (memcmp(hdr->sig,"RCmb",4) != 0 ||
2019 ntohl(hdr->totlen) < CLUSTERMSG_MIN_LEN)
2020 {
2021 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2022 "Bad message length or signature received "
2023 "from Cluster bus.");
2024 handleLinkIOError(link);
2025 return;
2026 }
2027 }
2028 readlen = ntohl(hdr->totlen) - rcvbuflen;
2029 if (readlen > sizeof(buf)) readlen = sizeof(buf);
2030 }
2031
2032 nread = read(fd,buf,readlen);
2033 if (nread == -1 && errno == EAGAIN) return; /* No more data ready. */
2034
2035 if (nread <= 0) {
2036 /* I/O error... */
2037 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"I/O error reading from node link: %s",
2038 (nread == 0) ? "connection closed" : strerror(errno));
2039 handleLinkIOError(link);
2040 return;
2041 } else {
2042 /* Read data and recast the pointer to the new buffer. */
2043 link->rcvbuf = sdscatlen(link->rcvbuf,buf,nread);
2044 hdr = (clusterMsg*) link->rcvbuf;
2045 rcvbuflen += nread;
2046 }
2047
2048 /* Total length obtained? Process this packet. */
2049 if (rcvbuflen >= 8 && rcvbuflen == ntohl(hdr->totlen)) {
2050 if (clusterProcessPacket(link)) {
2051 sdsfree(link->rcvbuf);
2052 link->rcvbuf = sdsempty();
2053 } else {
2054 return; /* Link no longer valid. */
2055 }
2056 }
2057 }
2058}
2059
2060/* Put stuff into the send buffer.
2061 *
2062 * It is guaranteed that this function will never have as a side effect
2063 * the link to be invalidated, so it is safe to call this function
2064 * from event handlers that will do stuff with the same link later. */
2065void clusterSendMessage(clusterLink *link, unsigned char *msg, size_t msglen) {
2066 if (sdslen(link->sndbuf) == 0 && msglen != 0)
2067 aeCreateFileEvent(server.el,link->fd,AE_WRITABLE,
2068 clusterWriteHandler,link);
2069
2070 link->sndbuf = sdscatlen(link->sndbuf, msg, msglen);
2071 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent++;
2072}
2073
2074/* Send a message to all the nodes that are part of the cluster having
2075 * a connected link.
2076 *
2077 * It is guaranteed that this function will never have as a side effect
2078 * some node->link to be invalidated, so it is safe to call this function
2079 * from event handlers that will do stuff with node links later. */
2080void clusterBroadcastMessage(void *buf, size_t len) {
2081 dictIterator *di;
2082 dictEntry *de;
2083
2084 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
2085 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2086 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
2087
2088 if (!node->link) continue;
2089 if (node->flags & (REDIS_NODE_MYSELF|REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE))
2090 continue;
2091 clusterSendMessage(node->link,buf,len);
2092 }
2093 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2094}
2095
2096/* Build the message header. hdr must point to a buffer at least
2097 * sizeof(clusterMsg) in bytes. */
2098void clusterBuildMessageHdr(clusterMsg *hdr, int type) {
2099 int totlen = 0;
2100 uint64_t offset;
2101 clusterNode *master;
2102
2103 /* If this node is a master, we send its slots bitmap and configEpoch.
2104 * If this node is a slave we send the master's information instead (the
2105 * node is flagged as slave so the receiver knows that it is NOT really
2106 * in charge for this slots. */
2107 master = (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof) ?
2108 myself->slaveof : myself;
2109
2110 memset(hdr,0,sizeof(*hdr));
2111 hdr->ver = htons(CLUSTER_PROTO_VER);
2112 hdr->sig[0] = 'R';
2113 hdr->sig[1] = 'C';
2114 hdr->sig[2] = 'm';
2115 hdr->sig[3] = 'b';
2116 hdr->type = htons(type);
2117 memcpy(hdr->sender,myself->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2118
2119 memcpy(hdr->myslots,master->slots,sizeof(hdr->myslots));
2120 memset(hdr->slaveof,0,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2121 if (myself->slaveof != NULL)
2122 memcpy(hdr->slaveof,myself->slaveof->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2123 hdr->port = htons(server.port);
2124 hdr->flags = htons(myself->flags);
2125 hdr->state = server.cluster->state;
2126
2127 /* Set the currentEpoch and configEpochs. */
2128 hdr->currentEpoch = htonu64(server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2129 hdr->configEpoch = htonu64(master->configEpoch);
2130
2131 /* Set the replication offset. */
2132 if (nodeIsSlave(myself))
2133 offset = replicationGetSlaveOffset();
2134 else
2135 offset = server.master_repl_offset;
2136 hdr->offset = htonu64(offset);
2137
2138 /* Set the message flags. */
2139 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) && server.cluster->mf_end)
2140 hdr->mflags[0] |= CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_PAUSED;
2141
2142 /* Compute the message length for certain messages. For other messages
2143 * this is up to the caller. */
2144 if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAIL) {
2145 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2146 totlen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataFail);
2147 } else if (type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE) {
2148 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2149 totlen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataUpdate);
2150 }
2151 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2152 /* For PING, PONG, and MEET, fixing the totlen field is up to the caller. */
2153}
2154
2155/* Send a PING or PONG packet to the specified node, making sure to add enough
2156 * gossip informations. */
2157void clusterSendPing(clusterLink *link, int type) {
2158 unsigned char *buf;
2159 clusterMsg *hdr;
2160 int gossipcount = 0; /* Number of gossip sections added so far. */
2161 int wanted; /* Number of gossip sections we want to append if possible. */
2162 int totlen; /* Total packet length. */
2163 /* freshnodes is the max number of nodes we can hope to append at all:
2164 * nodes available minus two (ourself and the node we are sending the
2165 * message to). However practically there may be less valid nodes since
2166 * nodes in handshake state, disconnected, are not considered. */
2167 int freshnodes = dictSize(server.cluster->nodes)-2;
2168
2169 /* How many gossip sections we want to add? 1/10 of the number of nodes
2170 * and anyway at least 3. Why 1/10?
2171 *
2172 * If we have N masters, with N/10 entries, and we consider that in
2173 * node_timeout we exchange with each other node at least 4 packets
2174 * (we ping in the worst case in node_timeout/2 time, and we also
2175 * receive two pings from the host), we have a total of 8 packets
2176 * in the node_timeout*2 falure reports validity time. So we have
2177 * that, for a single PFAIL node, we can expect to receive the following
2178 * number of failure reports (in the specified window of time):
2179 *
2180 * PROB * GOSSIP_ENTRIES_PER_PACKET * TOTAL_PACKETS:
2181 *
