2182 * PROB = probability of being featured in a single gossip entry,
2183 * which is 1 / NUM_OF_NODES.
2184 * ENTRIES = 10.
2185 * TOTAL_PACKETS = 2 * 4 * NUM_OF_MASTERS.
2186 *
2187 * If we assume we have just masters (so num of nodes and num of masters
2188 * is the same), with 1/10 we always get over the majority, and specifically
2189 * 80% of the number of nodes, to account for many masters failing at the
2190 * same time.
2191 *
2192 * Since we have non-voting slaves that lower the probability of an entry
2193 * to feature our node, we set the number of entires per packet as
2194 * 10% of the total nodes we have. */
2195 wanted = floor(dictSize(server.cluster->nodes)/10);
2196 if (wanted < 3) wanted = 3;
2197 if (wanted > freshnodes) wanted = freshnodes;
2198
2199 /* Compute the maxium totlen to allocate our buffer. We'll fix the totlen
2200 * later according to the number of gossip sections we really were able
2201 * to put inside the packet. */
2202 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2203 totlen += (sizeof(clusterMsgDataGossip)*wanted);
2204 /* Note: clusterBuildMessageHdr() expects the buffer to be always at least
2205 * sizeof(clusterMsg) or more. */
2206 if (totlen < (int)sizeof(clusterMsg)) totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg);
2207 buf = zcalloc(totlen);
2208 hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2209
2210 /* Populate the header. */
2211 if (link->node && type == CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING)
2212 link->node->ping_sent = mstime();
2213 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,type);
2214
2215 /* Populate the gossip fields */
2216 int maxiterations = wanted*3;
2217 while(freshnodes > 0 && gossipcount < wanted && maxiterations--) {
2218 dictEntry *de = dictGetRandomKey(server.cluster->nodes);
2219 clusterNode *this = dictGetVal(de);
2220 clusterMsgDataGossip *gossip;
2221 int j;
2222
2223 /* Don't include this node: the whole packet header is about us
2224 * already, so we just gossip about other nodes. */
2225 if (this == myself) continue;
2226
2227 /* Give a bias to FAIL/PFAIL nodes. */
2228 if (maxiterations > wanted*2 &&
2229 !(this->flags & (REDIS_NODE_PFAIL|REDIS_NODE_FAIL)))
2230 continue;
2231
2232 /* In the gossip section don't include:
2233 * 1) Nodes in HANDSHAKE state.
2234 * 3) Nodes with the NOADDR flag set.
2235 * 4) Disconnected nodes if they don't have configured slots.
2236 */
2237 if (this->flags & (REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE|REDIS_NODE_NOADDR) ||
2238 (this->link == NULL && this->numslots == 0))
2239 {
2240 freshnodes--; /* Tecnically not correct, but saves CPU. */
2241 continue;
2242 }
2243
2244 /* Check if we already added this node */
2245 for (j = 0; j < gossipcount; j++) {
2246 if (memcmp(hdr->data.ping.gossip[j].nodename,this->name,
2247 REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN) == 0) break;
2248 }
2249 if (j != gossipcount) continue;
2250
2251 /* Add it */
2252 freshnodes--;
2253 gossip = &(hdr->data.ping.gossip[gossipcount]);
2254 memcpy(gossip->nodename,this->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2255 gossip->ping_sent = htonl(this->ping_sent);
2256 gossip->pong_received = htonl(this->pong_received);
2257 memcpy(gossip->ip,this->ip,sizeof(this->ip));
2258 gossip->port = htons(this->port);
2259 gossip->flags = htons(this->flags);
2260 gossip->notused1 = 0;
2261 gossip->notused2 = 0;
2262 gossipcount++;
2263 }
2264
2265 /* Ready to send... fix the totlen fiend and queue the message in the
2266 * output buffer. */
2267 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2268 totlen += (sizeof(clusterMsgDataGossip)*gossipcount);
2269 hdr->count = htons(gossipcount);
2270 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2271 clusterSendMessage(link,buf,totlen);
2272 zfree(buf);
2273}
2274
2275/* Send a PONG packet to every connected node that's not in handshake state
2276 * and for which we have a valid link.
2277 *
2278 * In Redis Cluster pongs are not used just for failure detection, but also
2279 * to carry important configuration information. So broadcasting a pong is
2280 * useful when something changes in the configuration and we want to make
2281 * the cluster aware ASAP (for instance after a slave promotion).
2282 *
2283 * The 'target' argument specifies the receiving instances using the
2284 * defines below:
2285 *
2286 * CLUSTER_BROADCAST_ALL -> All known instances.
2287 * CLUSTER_BROADCAST_LOCAL_SLAVES -> All slaves in my master-slaves ring.
2288 */
2289#define CLUSTER_BROADCAST_ALL 0
2290#define CLUSTER_BROADCAST_LOCAL_SLAVES 1
2291void clusterBroadcastPong(int target) {
2292 dictIterator *di;
2293 dictEntry *de;
2294
2295 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
2296 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2297 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
2298
2299 if (!node->link) continue;
2300 if (node == myself || nodeInHandshake(node)) continue;
2301 if (target == CLUSTER_BROADCAST_LOCAL_SLAVES) {
2302 int local_slave =
2303 nodeIsSlave(node) && node->slaveof &&
2304 (node->slaveof == myself || node->slaveof == myself->slaveof);
2305 if (!local_slave) continue;
2306 }
2307 clusterSendPing(node->link,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG);
2308 }
2309 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2310}
2311
2312/* Send a PUBLISH message.
2313 *
2314 * If link is NULL, then the message is broadcasted to the whole cluster. */
2315void clusterSendPublish(clusterLink *link, robj *channel, robj *message) {
2316 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)], *payload;
2317 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2318 uint32_t totlen;
2319 uint32_t channel_len, message_len;
2320
2321 channel = getDecodedObject(channel);
2322 message = getDecodedObject(message);
2323 channel_len = sdslen(channel->ptr);
2324 message_len = sdslen(message->ptr);
2325
2326 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PUBLISH);
2327 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2328 totlen += sizeof(clusterMsgDataPublish) - 8 + channel_len + message_len;
2329
2330 hdr->data.publish.msg.channel_len = htonl(channel_len);
2331 hdr->data.publish.msg.message_len = htonl(message_len);
2332 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2333
2334 /* Try to use the local buffer if possible */
2335 if (totlen < sizeof(buf)) {
2336 payload = buf;
2337 } else {
2338 payload = zmalloc(totlen);
2339 memcpy(payload,hdr,sizeof(*hdr));
2340 hdr = (clusterMsg*) payload;
2341 }
2342 memcpy(hdr->data.publish.msg.bulk_data,channel->ptr,sdslen(channel->ptr));
2343 memcpy(hdr->data.publish.msg.bulk_data+sdslen(channel->ptr),
2344 message->ptr,sdslen(message->ptr));
2345
2346 if (link)
2347 clusterSendMessage(link,payload,totlen);
2348 else
2349 clusterBroadcastMessage(payload,totlen);
2350
2351 decrRefCount(channel);
2352 decrRefCount(message);
2353 if (payload != buf) zfree(payload);
2354}
2355
2356/* Send a FAIL message to all the nodes we are able to contact.
2357 * The FAIL message is sent when we detect that a node is failing
2358 * (REDIS_NODE_PFAIL) and we also receive a gossip confirmation of this:
2359 * we switch the node state to REDIS_NODE_FAIL and ask all the other
2360 * nodes to do the same ASAP. */
2361void clusterSendFail(char *nodename) {
2362 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2363 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2364
2365 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAIL);
2366 memcpy(hdr->data.fail.about.nodename,nodename,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2367 clusterBroadcastMessage(buf,ntohl(hdr->totlen));
2368}
2369
2370/* Send an UPDATE message to the specified link carrying the specified 'node'
2371 * slots configuration. The node name, slots bitmap, and configEpoch info
2372 * are included. */
2373void clusterSendUpdate(clusterLink *link, clusterNode *node) {
2374 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2375 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2376
2377 if (link == NULL) return;
2378 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE);
2379 memcpy(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.nodename,node->name,REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2380 hdr->data.update.nodecfg.configEpoch = htonu64(node->configEpoch);
2381 memcpy(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.slots,node->slots,sizeof(node->slots));
2382 clusterSendMessage(link,buf,ntohl(hdr->totlen));
2383}
2384
2385/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2386 * CLUSTER Pub/Sub support
2387 *
2388 * For now we do very little, just propagating PUBLISH messages across the whole
2389 * cluster. In the future we'll try to get smarter and avoiding propagating those
2390 * messages to hosts without receives for a given channel.
2391 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2392void clusterPropagatePublish(robj *channel, robj *message) {
2393 clusterSendPublish(NULL, channel, message);
2394}

2396/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2397 * SLAVE node specific functions
2398 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2399
2400/* This function sends a FAILOVE_AUTH_REQUEST message to every node in order to
2401 * see if there is the quorum for this slave instance to failover its failing
2402 * master.
2403 *
2404 * Note that we send the failover request to everybody, master and slave nodes,
2405 * but only the masters are supposed to reply to our query. */
2406void clusterRequestFailoverAuth(void) {
2407 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2408 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2409 uint32_t totlen;
2410
2411 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_REQUEST);
2412 /* If this is a manual failover, set the CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK bit
2413 * in the header to communicate the nodes receiving the message that
2414 * they should authorized the failover even if the master is working. */
2415 if (server.cluster->mf_end) hdr->mflags[0] |= CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK;
2416 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2417 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2418 clusterBroadcastMessage(buf,totlen);
2419}
2420
2421/* Send a FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK message to the specified node. */
2422void clusterSendFailoverAuth(clusterNode *node) {
2423 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2424 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2425 uint32_t totlen;
2426
2427 if (!node->link) return;
2428 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK);
2429 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2430 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2431 clusterSendMessage(node->link,buf,totlen);
2432}
2433
2434/* Send a MFSTART message to the specified node. */
2435void clusterSendMFStart(clusterNode *node) {
2436 unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2437 clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2438 uint32_t totlen;
2439
2440 if (!node->link) return;
2441 clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MFSTART);
2442 totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2443 hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2444 clusterSendMessage(node->link,buf,totlen);
2445}
2446
2447/* Vote for the node asking for our vote if there are the conditions. */
2448void clusterSendFailoverAuthIfNeeded(clusterNode *node, clusterMsg *request) {
2449 clusterNode *master = node->slaveof;
2450 uint64_t requestCurrentEpoch = ntohu64(request->currentEpoch);
2451 uint64_t requestConfigEpoch = ntohu64(request->configEpoch);
2452 unsigned char *claimed_slots = request->myslots;
2453 int force_ack = request->mflags[0] & CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK;
2454 int j;
2455
2456 /* IF we are not a master serving at least 1 slot, we don't have the
2457 * right to vote, as the cluster size in Redis Cluster is the number
2458 * of masters serving at least one slot, and quorum is the cluster
2459 * size + 1 */
2460 if (nodeIsSlave(myself) || myself->numslots == 0) return;
2461
2462 /* Request epoch must be >= our currentEpoch.
2463 * Note that it is impossible for it to actually be greater since
2464 * our currentEpoch was updated as a side effect of receiving this
2465 * request, if the request epoch was greater. */
2466 if (requestCurrentEpoch < server.cluster->currentEpoch) {
2467 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2468 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: reqEpoch (%llu) < curEpoch(%llu)",
2469 node->name,
2470 (unsigned long long) requestCurrentEpoch,
2471 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2472 return;
2473 }
2474
2475 /* I already voted for this epoch? Return ASAP. */
2476 if (server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch == server.cluster->currentEpoch) {
2477 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2478 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: already voted for epoch %llu",
2479 node->name,
2480 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2481 return;
2482 }
2483
2484 /* Node must be a slave and its master down.
2485 * The master can be non failing if the request is flagged
2486 * with CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK (manual failover). */
2487 if (nodeIsMaster(node) || master == NULL ||
2488 (!nodeFailed(master) && !force_ack))
2489 {
2490 if (nodeIsMaster(node)) {
2491 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2492 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: it is a master node",
2493 node->name);
2494 } else if (master == NULL) {
2495 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2496 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: I don't know its master",
2497 node->name);
2498 } else if (!nodeFailed(master)) {
2499 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2500 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: its master is up",
2501 node->name);
2502 }
2503 return;
2504 }
2505
2506 /* We did not voted for a slave about this master for two
2507 * times the node timeout. This is not strictly needed for correctness
2508 * of the algorithm but makes the base case more linear. */
2509 if (mstime() - node->slaveof->voted_time < server.cluster_node_timeout * 2)
2510 {
2511 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2512 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: "
2513 "can't vote about this master before %lld milliseconds",
2514 node->name,
2515 (long long) ((server.cluster_node_timeout*2)-
2516 (mstime() - node->slaveof->voted_time)));
2517 return;
2518 }
2519
2520 /* The slave requesting the vote must have a configEpoch for the claimed
2521 * slots that is >= the one of the masters currently serving the same
2522 * slots in the current configuration. */
2523 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
2524 if (bitmapTestBit(claimed_slots, j) == 0) continue;
2525 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL ||
2526 server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch <= requestConfigEpoch)
2527 {
2528 continue;
2529 }
2530 /* If we reached this point we found a slot that in our current slots
2531 * is served by a master with a greater configEpoch than the one claimed
2532 * by the slave requesting our vote. Refuse to vote for this slave. */
2533 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2534 "Failover auth denied to %.40s: "
2535 "slot %d epoch (%llu) > reqEpoch (%llu)",
2536 node->name, j,
2537 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch,
2538 (unsigned long long) requestConfigEpoch);
2539 return;
2540 }
2541
2542 /* We can vote for this slave. */
2543 clusterSendFailoverAuth(node);
2544 server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
2545 node->slaveof->voted_time = mstime();
2546 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING, "Failover auth granted to %.40s for epoch %llu",
2547 node->name, (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2548}
2549
2550/* This function returns the "rank" of this instance, a slave, in the context
2551 * of its master-slaves ring. The rank of the slave is given by the number of
2552 * other slaves for the same master that have a better replication offset
2553 * compared to the local one (better means, greater, so they claim more data).
2554 *
2555 * A slave with rank 0 is the one with the greatest (most up to date)
2556 * replication offset, and so forth. Note that because how the rank is computed
2557 * multiple slaves may have the same rank, in case they have the same offset.
2558 *
2559 * The slave rank is used to add a delay to start an election in order to
2560 * get voted and replace a failing master. Slaves with better replication
2561 * offsets are more likely to win. */
2562int clusterGetSlaveRank(void) {
2563 long long myoffset;
2564 int j, rank = 0;
2565 clusterNode *master;
2566
2567 redisAssert(nodeIsSlave(myself));
2568 master = myself->slaveof;
2569 if (master == NULL) return 0; /* Never called by slaves without master. */
2570
2571 myoffset = replicationGetSlaveOffset();
2572 for (j = 0; j < master->numslaves; j++)
2573 if (master->slaves[j] != myself &&
2574 master->slaves[j]->repl_offset > myoffset) rank++;
2575 return rank;
2576}
2577
2578/* This function is called by clusterHandleSlaveFailover() in order to
2579 * let the slave log why it is not able to failover. Sometimes there are
2580 * not the conditions, but since the failover function is called again and
2581 * again, we can't log the same things continuously.
2582 *
2583 * This function works by logging only if a given set of conditions are
2584 * true:
2585 *
2586 * 1) The reason for which the failover can't be initiated changed.
2587 * The reasons also include a NONE reason we reset the state to
2588 * when the slave finds that its master is fine (no FAIL flag).
2589 * 2) Also, the log is emitted again if the master is still down and
2590 * the reason for not failing over is still the same, but more than
2591 * REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_RELOG_PERIOD seconds elapsed.
2592 * 3) Finally, the function only logs if the slave is down for more than
2593 * five seconds + NODE_TIMEOUT. This way nothing is logged when a
2594 * failover starts in a reasonable time.
2595 *
2596 * The function is called with the reason why the slave can't failover
2597 * which is one of the integer macros REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_*.
2598 *
2599 * The function is guaranteed to be called only if 'myself' is a slave. */
2600void clusterLogCantFailover(int reason) {
2601 char *msg;
2602 static time_t lastlog_time = 0;
2603 mstime_t nolog_fail_time = server.cluster_node_timeout + 5000;
2604
2605 /* Don't log if we have the same reason for some time. */
2606 if (reason == server.cluster->cant_failover_reason &&
2607 time(NULL)-lastlog_time < REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_RELOG_PERIOD)
2608 return;
2609
2610 server.cluster->cant_failover_reason = reason;
2611
2612 /* We also don't emit any log if the master failed no long ago, the
2613 * goal of this function is to log slaves in a stalled condition for
2614 * a long time. */
2615 if (myself->slaveof &&
2616 nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) &&
2617 (mstime() - myself->slaveof->fail_time) < nolog_fail_time) return;
2618
2619 switch(reason) {
2620 case REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_DATA_AGE:
2621 msg = "Disconnected from master for longer than allowed.";
2622 break;
2623 case REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_DELAY:
2624 msg = "Waiting the delay before I can start a new failover.";
2625 break;
2626 case REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_EXPIRED:
2627 msg = "Failover attempt expired.";
2628 break;
2629 case REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_VOTES:
2630 msg = "Waiting for votes, but majority still not reached.";
2631 break;
2632 default:
2633 msg = "Unknown reason code.";
2634 break;
2635 }
2636 lastlog_time = time(NULL);
2637 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Currently unable to failover: %s", msg);
2638}
2639
2640/* This function implements the final part of automatic and manual failovers,
2641 * where the slave grabs its master's hash slots, and propagates the new
2642 * configuration.
2643 *
2644 * Note that it's up to the caller to be sure that the node got a new
2645 * configuration epoch already. */
2646void clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster(void) {
2647 int j;
2648 clusterNode *oldmaster = myself->slaveof;
2649
2650 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) || oldmaster == NULL) return;
2651
2652 /* 1) Turn this node into a master. */
2653 clusterSetNodeAsMaster(myself);
2654 replicationUnsetMaster();
2655
2656 /* 2) Claim all the slots assigned to our master. */
2657 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
2658 if (clusterNodeGetSlotBit(oldmaster,j)) {
2659 clusterDelSlot(j);
2660 clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
2661 }
2662 }
2663
2664 /* 3) Update state and save config. */
2665 clusterUpdateState();
2666 clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
2667
2668 /* 4) Pong all the other nodes so that they can update the state
2669 * accordingly and detect that we switched to master role. */
2670 clusterBroadcastPong(CLUSTER_BROADCAST_ALL);
2671
2672 /* 5) If there was a manual failover in progress, clear the state. */
2673 resetManualFailover();
2674}
2675
2676/* This function is called if we are a slave node and our master serving
2677 * a non-zero amount of hash slots is in FAIL state.
2678 *
2679 * The gaol of this function is:
2680 * 1) To check if we are able to perform a failover, is our data updated?
2681 * 2) Try to get elected by masters.
2682 * 3) Perform the failover informing all the other nodes.
2683 */
2684void clusterHandleSlaveFailover(void) {
2685 mstime_t data_age;
2686 mstime_t auth_age = mstime() - server.cluster->failover_auth_time;
2687 int needed_quorum = (server.cluster->size / 2) + 1;
2688 int manual_failover = server.cluster->mf_end != 0 &&
2689 server.cluster->mf_can_start;
2690 mstime_t auth_timeout, auth_retry_time;
2691
2692 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_HANDLE_FAILOVER;
2693
2694 /* Compute the failover timeout (the max time we have to send votes
2695 * and wait for replies), and the failover retry time (the time to wait
2696 * before trying to get voted again).
2697 *
2698 * Timeout is MIN(NODE_TIMEOUT*2,2000) milliseconds.
2699 * Retry is two times the Timeout.
2700 */
2701 auth_timeout = server.cluster_node_timeout*2;
2702 if (auth_timeout < 2000) auth_timeout = 2000;
2703 auth_retry_time = auth_timeout*2;
2704
2705 /* Pre conditions to run the function, that must be met both in case
2706 * of an automatic or manual failover:
2707 * 1) We are a slave.
2708 * 2) Our master is flagged as FAIL, or this is a manual failover.
2709 * 3) It is serving slots. */
2710 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) ||
2711 myself->slaveof == NULL ||
2712 (!nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) && !manual_failover) ||
2713 myself->slaveof->numslots == 0)
2714 {
2715 /* There are no reasons to failover, so we set the reason why we
2716 * are returning without failing over to NONE. */
2717 server.cluster->cant_failover_reason = REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_NONE;
2718 return;
2719 }
2720
2721 /* Set data_age to the number of seconds we are disconnected from
2722 * the master. */
2723 if (server.repl_state == REDIS_REPL_CONNECTED) {
2724 data_age = (mstime_t)(server.unixtime - server.master->lastinteraction)
2725 * 1000;
2726 } else {
2727 data_age = (mstime_t)(server.unixtime - server.repl_down_since) * 1000;
2728 }
2729
2730 /* Remove the node timeout from the data age as it is fine that we are
2731 * disconnected from our master at least for the time it was down to be
2732 * flagged as FAIL, that's the baseline. */
2733 if (data_age > server.cluster_node_timeout)
2734 data_age -= server.cluster_node_timeout;
2735
2736 /* Check if our data is recent enough according to the slave validity
2737 * factor configured by the user.
2738 *
2739 * Check bypassed for manual failovers. */
2740 if (server.cluster_slave_validity_factor &&
2741 data_age >
2742 (((mstime_t)server.repl_ping_slave_period * 1000) +
2743 (server.cluster_node_timeout * server.cluster_slave_validity_factor)))
2744 {
2745 if (!manual_failover) {
2746 clusterLogCantFailover(REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_DATA_AGE);
2747 return;
2748 }
2749 }
2750
2751 /* If the previous failover attempt timedout and the retry time has
2752 * elapsed, we can setup a new one. */
2753 if (auth_age > auth_retry_time) {
2754 server.cluster->failover_auth_time = mstime() +
2755 500 + /* Fixed delay of 500 milliseconds, let FAIL msg propagate. */
2756 random() % 500; /* Random delay between 0 and 500 milliseconds. */
2757 server.cluster->failover_auth_count = 0;
2758 server.cluster->failover_auth_sent = 0;
2759 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = clusterGetSlaveRank();
2760 /* We add another delay that is proportional to the slave rank.
2761 * Specifically 1 second * rank. This way slaves that have a probably
2762 * less updated replication offset, are penalized. */
2763 server.cluster->failover_auth_time +=
2764 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank * 1000;
2765 /* However if this is a manual failover, no delay is needed. */
2766 if (server.cluster->mf_end) {
2767 server.cluster->failover_auth_time = mstime();
2768 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = 0;
2769 }
2770 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2771 "Start of election delayed for %lld milliseconds "
2772 "(rank #%d, offset %lld).",
2773 server.cluster->failover_auth_time - mstime(),
2774 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank,
2775 replicationGetSlaveOffset());
2776 /* Now that we have a scheduled election, broadcast our offset
2777 * to all the other slaves so that they'll updated their offsets
2778 * if our offset is better. */
2779 clusterBroadcastPong(CLUSTER_BROADCAST_LOCAL_SLAVES);
2780 return;
2781 }
2782
2783 /* It is possible that we received more updated offsets from other
2784 * slaves for the same master since we computed our election delay.
2785 * Update the delay if our rank changed.
2786 *
2787 * Not performed if this is a manual failover. */
2788 if (server.cluster->failover_auth_sent == 0 &&
2789 server.cluster->mf_end == 0)
2790 {
2791 int newrank = clusterGetSlaveRank();
2792 if (newrank > server.cluster->failover_auth_rank) {
2793 long long added_delay =
2794 (newrank - server.cluster->failover_auth_rank) * 1000;
2795 server.cluster->failover_auth_time += added_delay;
2796 server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = newrank;
2797 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2798 "Slave rank updated to #%d, added %lld milliseconds of delay.",
2799 newrank, added_delay);
2800 }
2801 }
2802
2803 /* Return ASAP if we can't still start the election. */
2804 if (mstime() < server.cluster->failover_auth_time) {
2805 clusterLogCantFailover(REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_DELAY);
2806 return;
2807 }
2808
2809 /* Return ASAP if the election is too old to be valid. */
2810 if (auth_age > auth_timeout) {
2811 clusterLogCantFailover(REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_EXPIRED);
2812 return;
2813 }
2814
2815 /* Ask for votes if needed. */
2816 if (server.cluster->failover_auth_sent == 0) {
2817 server.cluster->currentEpoch++;
2818 server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
2819 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Starting a failover election for epoch %llu.",
2820 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2821 clusterRequestFailoverAuth();
2822 server.cluster->failover_auth_sent = 1;
2823 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
2824 CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
2825 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
2826 return; /* Wait for replies. */
2827 }
2828
2829 /* Check if we reached the quorum. */
2830 if (server.cluster->failover_auth_count >= needed_quorum) {
2831 /* We have the quorum, we can finally failover the master. */
2832
2833 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2834 "Failover election won: I'm the new master.");
2835
2836 /* Update my configEpoch to the epoch of the election. */
2837 if (myself->configEpoch < server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch) {
2838 myself->configEpoch = server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch;
2839 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
2840 "configEpoch set to %llu after successful failover",
2841 (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
2842 }
2843
2844 /* Take responsability for the cluster slots. */
2845 clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster();
2846 } else {
2847 clusterLogCantFailover(REDIS_CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_VOTES);
2848 }
2849}
2850
2851/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2852 * CLUSTER slave migration
2853 *
2854 * Slave migration is the process that allows a slave of a master that is
2855 * already covered by at least another slave, to "migrate" to a master that
2856 * is orpaned, that is, left with no working slaves.
2857 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2858
2859/* This function is responsible to decide if this replica should be migrated
2860 * to a different (orphaned) master. It is called by the clusterCron() function
2861 * only if:
2862 *
2863 * 1) We are a slave node.
2864 * 2) It was detected that there is at least one orphaned master in
2865 * the cluster.
2866 * 3) We are a slave of one of the masters with the greatest number of
2867 * slaves.
2868 *
2869 * This checks are performed by the caller since it requires to iterate
2870 * the nodes anyway, so we spend time into clusterHandleSlaveMigration()
2871 * if definitely needed.
2872 *
2873 * The fuction is called with a pre-computed max_slaves, that is the max
2874 * number of working (not in FAIL state) slaves for a single master.
2875 *
2876 * Additional conditions for migration are examined inside the function.
2877 */
2878void clusterHandleSlaveMigration(int max_slaves) {
2879 int j, okslaves = 0;
2880 clusterNode *mymaster = myself->slaveof, *target = NULL, *candidate = NULL;
2881 dictIterator *di;
2882 dictEntry *de;
2883
2884 /* Step 1: Don't migrate if the cluster state is not ok. */
2885 if (server.cluster->state != REDIS_CLUSTER_OK) return;
2886
2887 /* Step 2: Don't migrate if my master will not be left with at least
2888 * 'migration-barrier' slaves after my migration. */
2889 if (mymaster == NULL) return;
2890 for (j = 0; j < mymaster->numslaves; j++)
2891 if (!nodeFailed(mymaster->slaves[j]) &&
2892 !nodeTimedOut(mymaster->slaves[j])) okslaves++;
2893 if (okslaves <= server.cluster_migration_barrier) return;
2894
2895 /* Step 3: Idenitfy a candidate for migration, and check if among the
2896 * masters with the greatest number of ok slaves, I'm the one with the
2897 * smaller node ID.
2898 *
2899 * Note that this means that eventually a replica migration will occurr
2900 * since slaves that are reachable again always have their FAIL flag
2901 * cleared. At the same time this does not mean that there are no
2902 * race conditions possible (two slaves migrating at the same time), but
2903 * this is extremely unlikely to happen, and harmless. */
2904 candidate = myself;
2905 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
2906 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2907 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
2908 int okslaves;
2909
2910 /* Only iterate over working masters. */
2911 if (nodeIsSlave(node) || nodeFailed(node)) continue;
2912 /* If this master never had slaves so far, don't migrate. We want
2913 * to migrate to a master that remained orphaned, not masters that
2914 * were never configured to have slaves. */
2915 if (node->numslaves == 0) continue;
2916 okslaves = clusterCountNonFailingSlaves(node);
2917
2918 if (okslaves == 0 && target == NULL && node->numslots > 0)
2919 target = node;
2920
2921 if (okslaves == max_slaves) {
2922 for (j = 0; j < node->numslaves; j++) {
2923 if (memcmp(node->slaves[j]->name,
2924 candidate->name,
2925 REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN) < 0)
2926 {
2927 candidate = node->slaves[j];
2928 }
2929 }
2930 }
2931 }
2932 dictReleaseIterator(di);
2933
2934 /* Step 4: perform the migration if there is a target, and if I'm the
2935 * candidate. */
2936 if (target && candidate == myself) {
2937 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Migrating to orphaned master %.40s",
2938 target->name);
2939 clusterSetMaster(target);
2940 }
2941}
2942
2943/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2944 * CLUSTER manual failover
2945 *
2946 * This are the important steps performed by slaves during a manual failover:
2947 * 1) User send CLUSTER FAILOVER command. The failover state is initialized
2948 * setting mf_end to the millisecond unix time at which we'll abort the
2949 * attempt.
2950 * 2) Slave sends a MFSTART message to the master requesting to pause clients
2951 * for two times the manual failover timeout REDIS_CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT.
2952 * When master is paused for manual failover, it also starts to flag
2953 * packets with CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_PAUSED.
2954 * 3) Slave waits for master to send its replication offset flagged as PAUSED.
2955 * 4) If slave received the offset from the master, and its offset matches,
2956 * mf_can_start is set to 1, and clusterHandleSlaveFailover() will perform
2957 * the failover as usually, with the difference that the vote request
2958 * will be modified to force masters to vote for a slave that has a
2959 * working master.
2960 *
2961 * From the point of view of the master things are simpler: when a
2962 * PAUSE_CLIENTS packet is received the master sets mf_end as well and
2963 * the sender in mf_slave. During the time limit for the manual failover
2964 * the master will just send PINGs more often to this slave, flagged with
2965 * the PAUSED flag, so that the slave will set mf_master_offset when receiving
2966 * a packet from the master with this flag set.
2967 *
2968 * The gaol of the manual failover is to perform a fast failover without
2969 * data loss due to the asynchronous master-slave replication.
2970 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
2971
2972/* Reset the manual failover state. This works for both masters and slavesa
2973 * as all the state about manual failover is cleared.
2974 *
2975 * The function can be used both to initialize the manual failover state at
2976 * startup or to abort a manual failover in progress. */
2977void resetManualFailover(void) {
2978 if (server.cluster->mf_end && clientsArePaused()) {
2979 server.clients_pause_end_time = 0;
2980 clientsArePaused(); /* Just use the side effect of the function. */
2981 }
2982 server.cluster->mf_end = 0; /* No manual failover in progress. */
2983 server.cluster->mf_can_start = 0;
2984 server.cluster->mf_slave = NULL;
2985 server.cluster->mf_master_offset = 0;
2986}
2987
2988/* If a manual failover timed out, abort it. */
2989void manualFailoverCheckTimeout(void) {
2990 if (server.cluster->mf_end && server.cluster->mf_end < mstime()) {
2991 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Manual failover timed out.");
2992 resetManualFailover();
2993 }
2994}
2995
2996/* This function is called from the cluster cron function in order to go
2997 * forward with a manual failover state machine. */
2998void clusterHandleManualFailover(void) {
2999 /* Return ASAP if no manual failover is in progress. */
3000 if (server.cluster->mf_end == 0) return;
3001
3002 /* If mf_can_start is non-zero, the failover was already triggered so the
3003 * next steps are performed by clusterHandleSlaveFailover(). */
3004 if (server.cluster->mf_can_start) return;
3005
3006 if (server.cluster->mf_master_offset == 0) return; /* Wait for offset... */
3007
3008 if (server.cluster->mf_master_offset == replicationGetSlaveOffset()) {
3009 /* Our replication offset matches the master replication offset
3010 * announced after clients were paused. We can start the failover. */
3011 server.cluster->mf_can_start = 1;
3012 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
3013 "All master replication stream processed, "
3014 "manual failover can start.");
3015 }
3016}
3017
3018/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3019 * CLUSTER cron job
3020 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3021
3022/* This is executed 10 times every second */
3023void clusterCron(void) {
3024 dictIterator *di;
3025 dictEntry *de;
3026 int update_state = 0;
3027 int orphaned_masters; /* How many masters there are without ok slaves. */
3028 int max_slaves; /* Max number of ok slaves for a single master. */
3029 int this_slaves; /* Number of ok slaves for our master (if we are slave). */
3030 mstime_t min_pong = 0, now = mstime();
3031 clusterNode *min_pong_node = NULL;
3032 static unsigned long long iteration = 0;
3033 mstime_t handshake_timeout;
3034
3035 iteration++; /* Number of times this function was called so far. */
3036
3037 /* The handshake timeout is the time after which a handshake node that was
3038 * not turned into a normal node is removed from the nodes. Usually it is
3039 * just the NODE_TIMEOUT value, but when NODE_TIMEOUT is too small we use
3040 * the value of 1 second. */
3041 handshake_timeout = server.cluster_node_timeout;
3042 if (handshake_timeout < 1000) handshake_timeout = 1000;
3043
3044 /* Check if we have disconnected nodes and re-establish the connection. */
3045 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3046 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3047 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3048
3049 if (node->flags & (REDIS_NODE_MYSELF|REDIS_NODE_NOADDR)) continue;
3050
3051 /* A Node in HANDSHAKE state has a limited lifespan equal to the
3052 * configured node timeout. */
3053 if (nodeInHandshake(node) && now - node->ctime > handshake_timeout) {
3054 clusterDelNode(node);
3055 continue;
3056 }
3057
3058 if (node->link == NULL) {
3059 int fd;
3060 mstime_t old_ping_sent;
3061 clusterLink *link;
3062
3063 fd = anetTcpNonBlockBindConnect(server.neterr, node->ip,
3064 node->port+REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR, REDIS_BIND_ADDR);
3065 if (fd == -1) {
3066 /* We got a synchronous error from connect before
3067 * clusterSendPing() had a chance to be called.
3068 * If node->ping_sent is zero, failure detection can't work,
3069 * so we claim we actually sent a ping now (that will
3070 * be really sent as soon as the link is obtained). */
3071 if (node->ping_sent == 0) node->ping_sent = mstime();
3072 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG, "Unable to connect to "
3073 "Cluster Node [%s]:%d -> %s", node->ip,
3074 node->port+REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR,
3075 server.neterr);
3076 continue;
3077 }
3078 link = createClusterLink(node);
3079 link->fd = fd;
3080 node->link = link;
3081 aeCreateFileEvent(server.el,link->fd,AE_READABLE,
3082 clusterReadHandler,link);
3083 /* Queue a PING in the new connection ASAP: this is crucial
3084 * to avoid false positives in failure detection.
3085 *
3086 * If the node is flagged as MEET, we send a MEET message instead
3087 * of a PING one, to force the receiver to add us in its node
3088 * table. */
3089 old_ping_sent = node->ping_sent;
3090 clusterSendPing(link, node->flags & REDIS_NODE_MEET ?
3091 CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET : CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3092 if (old_ping_sent) {
3093 /* If there was an active ping before the link was
3094 * disconnected, we want to restore the ping time, otherwise
3095 * replaced by the clusterSendPing() call. */
3096 node->ping_sent = old_ping_sent;
3097 }
3098 /* We can clear the flag after the first packet is sent.
3099 * If we'll never receive a PONG, we'll never send new packets
3100 * to this node. Instead after the PONG is received and we
3101 * are no longer in meet/handshake status, we want to send
3102 * normal PING packets. */
3103 node->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_MEET;
3104
3105 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"Connecting with Node %.40s at %s:%d",
3106 node->name, node->ip, node->port+REDIS_CLUSTER_PORT_INCR);
3107 }
3108 }
3109 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3110
3111 /* Ping some random node 1 time every 10 iterations, so that we usually ping
3112 * one random node every second. */
3113 if (!(iteration % 10)) {
3114 int j;
3115
3116 /* Check a few random nodes and ping the one with the oldest
3117 * pong_received time. */
3118 for (j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
3119 de = dictGetRandomKey(server.cluster->nodes);
3120 clusterNode *this = dictGetVal(de);
3121
3122 /* Don't ping nodes disconnected or with a ping currently active. */
3123 if (this->link == NULL || this->ping_sent != 0) continue;
3124 if (this->flags & (REDIS_NODE_MYSELF|REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE))
3125 continue;
3126 if (min_pong_node == NULL || min_pong > this->pong_received) {
3127 min_pong_node = this;
3128 min_pong = this->pong_received;
3129 }
3130 }
3131 if (min_pong_node) {
3132 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"Pinging node %.40s", min_pong_node->name);
3133 clusterSendPing(min_pong_node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3134 }
3135 }
3136
3137 /* Iterate nodes to check if we need to flag something as failing.
3138 * This loop is also responsible to:
3139 * 1) Check if there are orphaned masters (masters without non failing
3140 * slaves).
3141 * 2) Count the max number of non failing slaves for a single master.
3142 * 3) Count the number of slaves for our master, if we are a slave. */
3143 orphaned_masters = 0;
3144 max_slaves = 0;
3145 this_slaves = 0;
3146 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3147 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3148 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3149 now = mstime(); /* Use an updated time at every iteration. */
3150 mstime_t delay;
3151
3152 if (node->flags &
3153 (REDIS_NODE_MYSELF|REDIS_NODE_NOADDR|REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE))
3154 continue;
3155
3156 /* Orphaned master check, useful only if the current instance
3157 * is a slave that may migrate to another master. */
3158 if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && nodeIsMaster(node) && !nodeFailed(node)) {
3159 int okslaves = clusterCountNonFailingSlaves(node);
3160
3161 /* A master is orphaned if it is serving a non-zero number of
3162 * slots, have no working slaves, but used to have at least one
3163 * slave. */
3164 if (okslaves == 0 && node->numslots > 0 && node->numslaves)
3165 orphaned_masters++;
3166 if (okslaves > max_slaves) max_slaves = okslaves;
3167 if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof == node)
3168 this_slaves = okslaves;
3169 }
3170
3171 /* If we are waiting for the PONG more than half the cluster
3172 * timeout, reconnect the link: maybe there is a connection
3173 * issue even if the node is alive. */
3174 if (node->link && /* is connected */
3175 now - node->link->ctime >
3176 server.cluster_node_timeout && /* was not already reconnected */
3177 node->ping_sent && /* we already sent a ping */
3178 node->pong_received < node->ping_sent && /* still waiting pong */
3179 /* and we are waiting for the pong more than timeout/2 */
3180 now - node->ping_sent > server.cluster_node_timeout/2)
3181 {
3182 /* Disconnect the link, it will be reconnected automatically. */
3183 freeClusterLink(node->link);
3184 }
3185
3186 /* If we have currently no active ping in this instance, and the
3187 * received PONG is older than half the cluster timeout, send
3188 * a new ping now, to ensure all the nodes are pinged without
3189 * a too big delay. */
3190 if (node->link &&
3191 node->ping_sent == 0 &&
3192 (now - node->pong_received) > server.cluster_node_timeout/2)
3193 {
3194 clusterSendPing(node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3195 continue;
3196 }
3197
3198 /* If we are a master and one of the slaves requested a manual
3199 * failover, ping it continuously. */
3200 if (server.cluster->mf_end &&
3201 nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3202 server.cluster->mf_slave == node &&
3203 node->link)
3204 {
3205 clusterSendPing(node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3206 continue;
3207 }
3208
3209 /* Check only if we have an active ping for this instance. */
3210 if (node->ping_sent == 0) continue;
3211
3212 /* Compute the delay of the PONG. Note that if we already received
3213 * the PONG, then node->ping_sent is zero, so can't reach this
3214 * code at all. */
3215 delay = now - node->ping_sent;
3216
3217 if (delay > server.cluster_node_timeout) {
3218 /* Timeout reached. Set the node as possibly failing if it is
3219 * not already in this state. */
3220 if (!(node->flags & (REDIS_NODE_PFAIL|REDIS_NODE_FAIL))) {
3221 redisLog(REDIS_DEBUG,"*** NODE %.40s possibly failing",
3222 node->name);
3223 node->flags |= REDIS_NODE_PFAIL;
3224 update_state = 1;
3225 }
3226 }
3227 }
3228 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3229
3230 /* If we are a slave node but the replication is still turned off,
3231 * enable it if we know the address of our master and it appears to
3232 * be up. */
3233 if (nodeIsSlave(myself) &&
3234 server.masterhost == NULL &&
3235 myself->slaveof &&
3236 nodeHasAddr(myself->slaveof))
3237 {
3238 replicationSetMaster(myself->slaveof->ip, myself->slaveof->port);
3239 }
3240
3241 /* Abourt a manual failover if the timeout is reached. */
3242 manualFailoverCheckTimeout();
3243
3244 if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) {
3245 clusterHandleManualFailover();
3246 clusterHandleSlaveFailover();
3247 /* If there are orphaned slaves, and we are a slave among the masters
3248 * with the max number of non-failing slaves, consider migrating to
3249 * the orphaned masters. Note that it does not make sense to try
3250 * a migration if there is no master with at least *two* working
3251 * slaves. */
3252 if (orphaned_masters && max_slaves >= 2 && this_slaves == max_slaves)
3253 clusterHandleSlaveMigration(max_slaves);
3254 }
3255
3256 if (update_state || server.cluster->state == REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL)
3257 clusterUpdateState();
3258}
3259
3260/* This function is called before the event handler returns to sleep for
3261 * events. It is useful to perform operations that must be done ASAP in
3262 * reaction to events fired but that are not safe to perform inside event
3263 * handlers, or to perform potentially expansive tasks that we need to do
3264 * a single time before replying to clients. */
3265void clusterBeforeSleep(void) {
3266 /* Handle failover, this is needed when it is likely that there is already
3267 * the quorum from masters in order to react fast. */
3268 if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_HANDLE_FAILOVER)
3269 clusterHandleSlaveFailover();
3270
3271 /* Update the cluster state. */
3272 if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE)
3273 clusterUpdateState();
3274
3275 /* Save the config, possibly using fsync. */
3276 if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG) {
3277 int fsync = server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &
3278 CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG;
3279 clusterSaveConfigOrDie(fsync);
3280 }
3281
3282 /* Reset our flags (not strictly needed since every single function
3283 * called for flags set should be able to clear its flag). */
3284 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep = 0;
3285}
3286
3287void clusterDoBeforeSleep(int flags) {
3288 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep |= flags;
3289}
3290
3291/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3292 * Slots management
3293 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3294
3295/* Test bit 'pos' in a generic bitmap. Return 1 if the bit is set,
3296 * otherwise 0. */
3297int bitmapTestBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3298 off_t byte = pos/8;
3299 int bit = pos&7;
3300 return (bitmap[byte] & (1<<bit)) != 0;
3301}
3302
3303/* Set the bit at position 'pos' in a bitmap. */
3304void bitmapSetBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3305 off_t byte = pos/8;
3306 int bit = pos&7;
3307 bitmap[byte] |= 1<<bit;
3308}
3309
3310/* Clear the bit at position 'pos' in a bitmap. */
3311void bitmapClearBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3312 off_t byte = pos/8;
3313 int bit = pos&7;
3314 bitmap[byte] &= ~(1<<bit);
3315}
3316
3317/* Set the slot bit and return the old value. */
3318int clusterNodeSetSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3319 int old = bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3320 bitmapSetBit(n->slots,slot);
3321 if (!old) n->numslots++;
3322 return old;
3323}
3324
3325/* Clear the slot bit and return the old value. */
3326int clusterNodeClearSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3327 int old = bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3328 bitmapClearBit(n->slots,slot);
3329 if (old) n->numslots--;
3330 return old;
3331}
3332
3333/* Return the slot bit from the cluster node structure. */
3334int clusterNodeGetSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3335 return bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3336}
3337
3338/* Add the specified slot to the list of slots that node 'n' will
3339 * serve. Return REDIS_OK if the operation ended with success.
3340 * If the slot is already assigned to another instance this is considered
3341 * an error and REDIS_ERR is returned. */
3342int clusterAddSlot(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3343 if (server.cluster->slots[slot]) return REDIS_ERR;
3344 clusterNodeSetSlotBit(n,slot);
3345 server.cluster->slots[slot] = n;
3346 return REDIS_OK;
3347}
3348
3349/* Delete the specified slot marking it as unassigned.
3350 * Returns REDIS_OK if the slot was assigned, otherwise if the slot was
3351 * already unassigned REDIS_ERR is returned. */
3352int clusterDelSlot(int slot) {
3353 clusterNode *n = server.cluster->slots[slot];
3354
3355 if (!n) return REDIS_ERR;
3356 redisAssert(clusterNodeClearSlotBit(n,slot) == 1);
3357 server.cluster->slots[slot] = NULL;
3358 return REDIS_OK;
3359}
3360
3361/* Delete all the slots associated with the specified node.
3362 * The number of deleted slots is returned. */
3363int clusterDelNodeSlots(clusterNode *node) {
3364 int deleted = 0, j;
3365
3366 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3367 if (clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) clusterDelSlot(j);
3368 deleted++;
3369 }
3370 return deleted;
3371}
3372
3373/* Clear the migrating / importing state for all the slots.
3374 * This is useful at initialization and when turning a master into slave. */
3375void clusterCloseAllSlots(void) {
3376 memset(server.cluster->migrating_slots_to,0,
3377 sizeof(server.cluster->migrating_slots_to));
3378 memset(server.cluster->importing_slots_from,0,
3379 sizeof(server.cluster->importing_slots_from));
3380}
3381
3382/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3383 * Cluster state evaluation function
3384 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3385
3386/* The following are defines that are only used in the evaluation function
3387 * and are based on heuristics. Actaully the main point about the rejoin and
3388 * writable delay is that they should be a few orders of magnitude larger
3389 * than the network latency. */
3390#define REDIS_CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY 5000
3391#define REDIS_CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY 500
3392#define REDIS_CLUSTER_WRITABLE_DELAY 2000
3393
3394void clusterUpdateState(void) {
3395 int j, new_state;
3396 int reachable_masters = 0;
3397 static mstime_t among_minority_time;
3398 static mstime_t first_call_time = 0;
3399
3400 server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE;
3401
3402 /* If this is a master node, wait some time before turning the state
3403 * into OK, since it is not a good idea to rejoin the cluster as a writable
3404 * master, after a reboot, without giving the cluster a chance to
3405 * reconfigure this node. Note that the delay is calculated starting from
3406 * the first call to this function and not since the server start, in order
3407 * to don't count the DB loading time. */
3408 if (first_call_time == 0) first_call_time = mstime();
3409 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3410 server.cluster->state == REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL &&
3411 mstime() - first_call_time < REDIS_CLUSTER_WRITABLE_DELAY) return;
3412
3413 /* Start assuming the state is OK. We'll turn it into FAIL if there
3414 * are the right conditions. */
3415 new_state = REDIS_CLUSTER_OK;
3416
3417 /* Check if all the slots are covered. */
3418 if (server.cluster_require_full_coverage) {
3419 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3420 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL ||
3421 server.cluster->slots[j]->flags & (REDIS_NODE_FAIL))
3422 {
3423 new_state = REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL;
3424 break;
3425 }
3426 }
3427 }
3428
3429 /* Compute the cluster size, that is the number of master nodes
3430 * serving at least a single slot.
3431 *
3432 * At the same time count the number of reachable masters having
3433 * at least one slot. */
3434 {
3435 dictIterator *di;
3436 dictEntry *de;
3437
3438 server.cluster->size = 0;
3439 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3440 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3441 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3442
3443 if (nodeIsMaster(node) && node->numslots) {
3444 server.cluster->size++;
3445 if ((node->flags & (REDIS_NODE_FAIL|REDIS_NODE_PFAIL)) == 0)
3446 reachable_masters++;
3447 }
3448 }
3449 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3450 }
3451
3452 /* If we are in a minority partition, change the cluster state
3453 * to FAIL. */
3454 {
3455 int needed_quorum = (server.cluster->size / 2) + 1;
3456
3457 if (reachable_masters < needed_quorum) {
3458 new_state = REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL;
3459 among_minority_time = mstime();
3460 }
3461 }
3462
3463 /* Log a state change */
3464 if (new_state != server.cluster->state) {
3465 mstime_t rejoin_delay = server.cluster_node_timeout;
3466
3467 /* If the instance is a master and was partitioned away with the
3468 * minority, don't let it accept queries for some time after the
3469 * partition heals, to make sure there is enough time to receive
3470 * a configuration update. */
3471 if (rejoin_delay > REDIS_CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY)
3472 rejoin_delay = REDIS_CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY;
3473 if (rejoin_delay < REDIS_CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY)
3474 rejoin_delay = REDIS_CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY;
3475
3476 if (new_state == REDIS_CLUSTER_OK &&
3477 nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3478 mstime() - among_minority_time < rejoin_delay)
3479 {
3480 return;
3481 }
3482
3483 /* Change the state and log the event. */
3484 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Cluster state changed: %s",
3485 new_state == REDIS_CLUSTER_OK ? "ok" : "fail");
3486 server.cluster->state = new_state;
3487 }
3488}
3489
3490/* This function is called after the node startup in order to verify that data
3491 * loaded from disk is in agreement with the cluster configuration:
3492 *
3493 * 1) If we find keys about hash slots we have no responsibility for, the
3494 * following happens:
3495 * A) If no other node is in charge according to the current cluster
3496 * configuration, we add these slots to our node.
3497 * B) If according to our config other nodes are already in charge for
3498 * this lots, we set the slots as IMPORTING from our point of view
3499 * in order to justify we have those slots, and in order to make
3500 * redis-trib aware of the issue, so that it can try to fix it.
3501 * 2) If we find data in a DB different than DB0 we return REDIS_ERR to
3502 * signal the caller it should quit the server with an error message
3503 * or take other actions.
3504 *
3505 * The function always returns REDIS_OK even if it will try to correct
3506 * the error described in "1". However if data is found in DB different
3507 * from DB0, REDIS_ERR is returned.
3508 *
3509 * The function also uses the logging facility in order to warn the user
3510 * about desynchronizations between the data we have in memory and the
3511 * cluster configuration. */
3512int verifyClusterConfigWithData(void) {
3513 int j;
3514 int update_config = 0;
3515
3516 /* If this node is a slave, don't perform the check at all as we
3517 * completely depend on the replication stream. */
3518 if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) return REDIS_OK;
3519
3520 /* Make sure we only have keys in DB0. */
3521 for (j = 1; j < server.dbnum; j++) {
3522 if (dictSize(server.db[j].dict)) return REDIS_ERR;
3523 }
3524
3525 /* Check that all the slots we see populated memory have a corresponding
3526 * entry in the cluster table. Otherwise fix the table. */
3527 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3528 if (!countKeysInSlot(j)) continue; /* No keys in this slot. */
3529 /* Check if we are assigned to this slot or if we are importing it.
3530 * In both cases check the next slot as the configuration makes
3531 * sense. */
3532 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == myself ||
3533 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] != NULL) continue;
3534
3535 /* If we are here data and cluster config don't agree, and we have
3536 * slot 'j' populated even if we are not importing it, nor we are
3537 * assigned to this slot. Fix this condition. */
3538
3539 update_config++;
3540 /* Case A: slot is unassigned. Take responsibility for it. */
3541 if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL) {
3542 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING, "I have keys for unassigned slot %d. "
3543 "Taking responsibility for it.",j);
3544 clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
3545 } else {
3546 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING, "I have keys for slot %d, but the slot is "
3547 "assigned to another node. "
3548 "Setting it to importing state.",j);
3549 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] = server.cluster->slots[j];
3550 }
3551 }
3552 if (update_config) clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
3553 return REDIS_OK;
3554}
3555
3556/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3557 * SLAVE nodes handling
3558 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3559
3560/* Set the specified node 'n' as master for this node.
3561 * If this node is currently a master, it is turned into a slave. */
3562void clusterSetMaster(clusterNode *n) {
3563 redisAssert(n != myself);
3564 redisAssert(myself->numslots == 0);
3565
3566 if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) {
3567 myself->flags &= ~REDIS_NODE_MASTER;
3568 myself->flags |= REDIS_NODE_SLAVE;
3569 clusterCloseAllSlots();
3570 } else {
3571 if (myself->slaveof)
3572 clusterNodeRemoveSlave(myself->slaveof,myself);
3573 }
3574 myself->slaveof = n;
3575 clusterNodeAddSlave(n,myself);
3576 replicationSetMaster(n->ip, n->port);
3577 resetManualFailover();
3578}
3579
3580/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3581 * Nodes to string representation functions.
3582 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3583
3584struct redisNodeFlags {
3585 uint16_t flag;
3586 char *name;
3587};
3588
3589static struct redisNodeFlags redisNodeFlagsTable[] = {
3590 {REDIS_NODE_MYSELF, "myself,"},
3591 {REDIS_NODE_MASTER, "master,"},
3592 {REDIS_NODE_SLAVE, "slave,"},
3593 {REDIS_NODE_PFAIL, "fail?,"},
3594 {REDIS_NODE_FAIL, "fail,"},
3595 {REDIS_NODE_HANDSHAKE, "handshake,"},
3596 {REDIS_NODE_NOADDR, "noaddr,"}
3597};
3598
3599/* Concatenate the comma separated list of node flags to the given SDS
3600 * string 'ci'. */
3601sds representRedisNodeFlags(sds ci, uint16_t flags) {
3602 if (flags == 0) {
3603 ci = sdscat(ci,"noflags,");
3604 } else {
3605 int i, size = sizeof(redisNodeFlagsTable)/sizeof(struct redisNodeFlags);
3606 for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3607 struct redisNodeFlags *nodeflag = redisNodeFlagsTable + i;
3608 if (flags & nodeflag->flag) ci = sdscat(ci, nodeflag->name);
3609 }
3610 }
3611 sdsIncrLen(ci,-1); /* Remove trailing comma. */
3612 return ci;
3613}
3614
3615/* Generate a csv-alike representation of the specified cluster node.
3616 * See clusterGenNodesDescription() top comment for more information.
3617 *
3618 * The function returns the string representation as an SDS string. */
3619sds clusterGenNodeDescription(clusterNode *node) {
3620 int j, start;
3621 sds ci;
3622
3623 /* Node coordinates */
3624 ci = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"%.40s %s:%d ",
3625 node->name,
3626 node->ip,
3627 node->port);
3628
3629 /* Flags */
3630 ci = representRedisNodeFlags(ci, node->flags);
3631
3632 /* Slave of... or just "-" */
3633 if (node->slaveof)
3634 ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %.40s ",node->slaveof->name);
3635 else
3636 ci = sdscatlen(ci," - ",3);
3637
3638 /* Latency from the POV of this node, config epoch, link status */
3639 ci = sdscatprintf(ci,"%lld %lld %llu %s",
3640 (long long) node->ping_sent,
3641 (long long) node->pong_received,
3642 (unsigned long long) node->configEpoch,
3643 (node->link || node->flags & REDIS_NODE_MYSELF) ?
3644 "connected" : "disconnected");
3645
3646 /* Slots served by this instance */
3647 start = -1;
3648 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3649 int bit;
3650
3651 if ((bit = clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) != 0) {
3652 if (start == -1) start = j;
3653 }
3654 if (start != -1 && (!bit || j == REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS-1)) {
3655 if (bit && j == REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS-1) j++;
3656
3657 if (start == j-1) {
3658 ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %d",start);
3659 } else {
3660 ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %d-%d",start,j-1);
3661 }
3662 start = -1;
3663 }
3664 }
3665
3666 /* Just for MYSELF node we also dump info about slots that
3667 * we are migrating to other instances or importing from other
3668 * instances. */
3669 if (node->flags & REDIS_NODE_MYSELF) {
3670 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3671 if (server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j]) {
3672 ci = sdscatprintf(ci," [%d->-%.40s]",j,
3673 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j]->name);
3674 } else if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j]) {
3675 ci = sdscatprintf(ci," [%d-<-%.40s]",j,
3676 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j]->name);
3677 }
3678 }
3679 }
3680 return ci;
3681}
3682
3683/* Generate a csv-alike representation of the nodes we are aware of,
3684 * including the "myself" node, and return an SDS string containing the
3685 * representation (it is up to the caller to free it).
3686 *
3687 * All the nodes matching at least one of the node flags specified in
3688 * "filter" are excluded from the output, so using zero as a filter will
3689 * include all the known nodes in the representation, including nodes in
3690 * the HANDSHAKE state.
3691 *
3692 * The representation obtained using this function is used for the output
3693 * of the CLUSTER NODES function, and as format for the cluster
3694 * configuration file (nodes.conf) for a given node. */
3695sds clusterGenNodesDescription(int filter) {
3696 sds ci = sdsempty(), ni;
3697 dictIterator *di;
3698 dictEntry *de;
3699
3700 di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3701 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3702 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3703
3704 if (node->flags & filter) continue;
3705 ni = clusterGenNodeDescription(node);
3706 ci = sdscatsds(ci,ni);
3707 sdsfree(ni);
3708 ci = sdscatlen(ci,"\n",1);
3709 }
3710 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3711 return ci;
3712}
3713
3714/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3715 * CLUSTER command
3716 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3717
3718int getSlotOrReply(redisClient *c, robj *o) {
3719 long long slot;
3720
3721 if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&slot) != REDIS_OK ||
3722 slot < 0 || slot >= REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS)
3723 {
3724 addReplyError(c,"Invalid or out of range slot");
3725 return -1;
3726 }
3727 return (int) slot;
3728}
3729
3730void clusterReplyMultiBulkSlots(redisClient *c) {
3731 /* Format: 1) 1) start slot
3732 * 2) end slot
3733 * 3) 1) master IP
3734 * 2) master port
3735 * 4) 1) replica IP
3736 * 2) replica port
3737 * ... continued until done
3738 */
3739
3740 int num_masters = 0;
3741 void *slot_replylen = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
3742
3743 dictEntry *de;
3744 dictIterator *di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3745 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3746 clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3747 int j = 0, start = -1;
3748
3749 /* Skip slaves (that are iterated when producing the output of their
3750 * master) and masters not serving any slot. */
3751 if (!nodeIsMaster(node) || node->numslots == 0) continue;
3752
3753 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3754 int bit, i;
3755
3756 if ((bit = clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) != 0) {
3757 if (start == -1) start = j;
3758 }
3759 if (start != -1 && (!bit || j == REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS-1)) {
3760 int nested_elements = 3; /* slots (2) + master addr (1). */
3761 void *nested_replylen = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
3762
3763 if (bit && j == REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS-1) j++;
3764
3765 /* If slot exists in output map, add to it's list.
3766 * else, create a new output map for this slot */
3767 if (start == j-1) {
3768 addReplyLongLong(c, start); /* only one slot; low==high */
3769 addReplyLongLong(c, start);
3770 } else {
3771 addReplyLongLong(c, start); /* low */
3772 addReplyLongLong(c, j-1); /* high */
3773 }
3774 start = -1;
3775
3776 /* First node reply position is always the master */
3777 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c, 2);
3778 addReplyBulkCString(c, node->ip);
3779 addReplyLongLong(c, node->port);
3780
3781 /* Remaining nodes in reply are replicas for slot range */
3782 for (i = 0; i < node->numslaves; i++) {
3783 /* This loop is copy/pasted from clusterGenNodeDescription()
3784 * with modifications for per-slot node aggregation */
3785 if (nodeFailed(node->slaves[i])) continue;
3786 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c, 2);
3787 addReplyBulkCString(c, node->slaves[i]->ip);
3788 addReplyLongLong(c, node->slaves[i]->port);
3789 nested_elements++;
3790 }
3791 setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c, nested_replylen, nested_elements);
3792 num_masters++;
3793 }
3794 }
3795 }
3796 dictReleaseIterator(di);
3797 setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c, slot_replylen, num_masters);
3798}
3799
3800void clusterCommand(redisClient *c) {
3801 if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
3802 addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
3803 return;
3804 }
3805
3806 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"meet") && c->argc == 4) {
3807 long long port;
3808
3809 if (getLongLongFromObject(c->argv[3], &port) != REDIS_OK) {
3810 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid TCP port specified: %s",
3811 (char*)c->argv[3]->ptr);
3812 return;
3813 }
3814
3815 if (clusterStartHandshake(c->argv[2]->ptr,port) == 0 &&
3816 errno == EINVAL)
3817 {
3818 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid node address specified: %s:%s",
3819 (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr, (char*)c->argv[3]->ptr);
3820 } else {
3821 addReply(c,shared.ok);
3822 }
3823 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"nodes") && c->argc == 2) {
3824 /* CLUSTER NODES */
3825 robj *o;
3826 sds ci = clusterGenNodesDescription(0);
3827
3828 o = createObject(REDIS_STRING,ci);
3829 addReplyBulk(c,o);
3830 decrRefCount(o);
3831 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"myid") && c->argc == 2) {
3832 /* CLUSTER MYID */
3833 addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,myself->name, REDIS_CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
3834 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slots") && c->argc == 2) {
3835 /* CLUSTER SLOTS */
3836 clusterReplyMultiBulkSlots(c);
3837 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"flushslots") && c->argc == 2) {
3838 /* CLUSTER FLUSHSLOTS */
3839 if (dictSize(server.db[0].dict) != 0) {
3840 addReplyError(c,"DB must be empty to perform CLUSTER FLUSHSLOTS.");
3841 return;
3842 }
3843 clusterDelNodeSlots(myself);
3844 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
3845 addReply(c,shared.ok);
3846 } else if ((!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"addslots") ||
3847 !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"delslots")) && c->argc >= 3)
3848 {
3849 /* CLUSTER ADDSLOTS <slot> [slot] ... */
3850 /* CLUSTER DELSLOTS <slot> [slot] ... */
3851 int j, slot;
3852 unsigned char *slots = zmalloc(REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS);
3853 int del = !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"delslots");
3854
3855 memset(slots,0,REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS);
3856 /* Check that all the arguments are parseable and that all the
3857 * slots are not already busy. */
3858 for (j = 2; j < c->argc; j++) {
3859 if ((slot = getSlotOrReply(c,c->argv[j])) == -1) {
3860 zfree(slots);
3861 return;
3862 }
3863 if (del && server.cluster->slots[slot] == NULL) {
3864 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d is already unassigned", slot);
3865 zfree(slots);
3866 return;
3867 } else if (!del && server.cluster->slots[slot]) {
3868 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d is already busy", slot);
3869 zfree(slots);
3870 return;
3871 }
3872 if (slots[slot]++ == 1) {
3873 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d specified multiple times",
3874 (int)slot);
3875 zfree(slots);
3876 return;
3877 }
3878 }
3879 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3880 if (slots[j]) {
3881 int retval;
3882
3883 /* If this slot was set as importing we can clear this
3884 * state as now we are the real owner of the slot. */
3885 if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j])
3886 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] = NULL;
3887
3888 retval = del ? clusterDelSlot(j) :
3889 clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
3890 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,retval == REDIS_OK);
3891 }
3892 }
3893 zfree(slots);
3894 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
3895 addReply(c,shared.ok);
3896 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"setslot") && c->argc >= 4) {
3897 /* SETSLOT 10 MIGRATING <node ID> */
3898 /* SETSLOT 10 IMPORTING <node ID> */
3899 /* SETSLOT 10 STABLE */
3900 /* SETSLOT 10 NODE <node ID> */
3901 int slot;
3902 clusterNode *n;
3903
3904 if ((slot = getSlotOrReply(c,c->argv[2])) == -1) return;
3905
3906 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"migrating") && c->argc == 5) {
3907 if (server.cluster->slots[slot] != myself) {
3908 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I'm not the owner of hash slot %u",slot);
3909 return;
3910 }
3911 if ((n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr)) == NULL) {
3912 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I don't know about node %s",
3913 (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
3914 return;
3915 }
3916 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = n;
3917 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"importing") && c->argc == 5) {
3918 if (server.cluster->slots[slot] == myself) {
3919 addReplyErrorFormat(c,
3920 "I'm already the owner of hash slot %u",slot);
3921 return;
3922 }
3923 if ((n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr)) == NULL) {
3924 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I don't know about node %s",
3925 (char*)c->argv[3]->ptr);
3926 return;
3927 }
3928 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = n;
3929 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"stable") && c->argc == 4) {
3930 /* CLUSTER SETSLOT <SLOT> STABLE */
3931 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = NULL;
3932 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = NULL;
3933 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"node") && c->argc == 5) {
3934 /* CLUSTER SETSLOT <SLOT> NODE <NODE ID> */
3935 clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr);
3936
3937 if (!n) {
3938 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s",
3939 (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
3940 return;
3941 }
3942 /* If this hash slot was served by 'myself' before to switch
3943 * make sure there are no longer local keys for this hash slot. */
3944 if (server.cluster->slots[slot] == myself && n != myself) {
3945 if (countKeysInSlot(slot) != 0) {
3946 addReplyErrorFormat(c,
3947 "Can't assign hashslot %d to a different node "
3948 "while I still hold keys for this hash slot.", slot);
3949 return;
3950 }
3951 }
3952 /* If this slot is in migrating status but we have no keys
3953 * for it assigning the slot to another node will clear
3954 * the migratig status. */
3955 if (countKeysInSlot(slot) == 0 &&
3956 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot])
3957 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = NULL;
3958
3959 /* If this node was importing this slot, assigning the slot to
3960 * itself also clears the importing status. */
3961 if (n == myself &&
3962 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot])
3963 {
3964 /* This slot was manually migrated, set this node configEpoch
3965 * to a new epoch so that the new version can be propagated
3966 * by the cluster.
3967 *
3968 * Note that if this ever results in a collision with another
3969 * node getting the same configEpoch, for example because a
3970 * failover happens at the same time we close the slot, the
3971 * configEpoch collision resolution will fix it assigning
3972 * a different epoch to each node. */
3973 if (clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus() == REDIS_OK) {
3974 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
3975 "configEpoch updated after importing slot %d", slot);
3976 }
3977 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = NULL;
3978 }
3979 clusterDelSlot(slot);
3980 clusterAddSlot(n,slot);
3981 } else {
3982 addReplyError(c,
3983 "Invalid CLUSTER SETSLOT action or number of arguments");
3984 return;
3985 }
3986 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
3987 addReply(c,shared.ok);
3988 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"info") && c->argc == 2) {
3989 /* CLUSTER INFO */
3990 char *statestr[] = {"ok","fail","needhelp"};
3991 int slots_assigned = 0, slots_ok = 0, slots_pfail = 0, slots_fail = 0;
3992 uint64_t myepoch;
3993 int j;
3994
3995 for (j = 0; j < REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3996 clusterNode *n = server.cluster->slots[j];
3997
3998 if (n == NULL) continue;
3999 slots_assigned++;
4000 if (nodeFailed(n)) {
4001 slots_fail++;
4002 } else if (nodeTimedOut(n)) {
4003 slots_pfail++;
4004 } else {
4005 slots_ok++;
4006 }
4007 }
4008
4009 myepoch = (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof) ?
4010 myself->slaveof->configEpoch : myself->configEpoch;
4011
4012 sds info = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
4013 "cluster_state:%s\r\n"
4014 "cluster_slots_assigned:%d\r\n"
4015 "cluster_slots_ok:%d\r\n"
4016 "cluster_slots_pfail:%d\r\n"
4017 "cluster_slots_fail:%d\r\n"
4018 "cluster_known_nodes:%lu\r\n"
4019 "cluster_size:%d\r\n"
4020 "cluster_current_epoch:%llu\r\n"
4021 "cluster_my_epoch:%llu\r\n"
4022 "cluster_stats_messages_sent:%lld\r\n"
4023 "cluster_stats_messages_received:%lld\r\n"
4024 , statestr[server.cluster->state],
4025 slots_assigned,
4026 slots_ok,
4027 slots_pfail,
4028 slots_fail,
4029 dictSize(server.cluster->nodes),
4030 server.cluster->size,
4031 (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch,
4032 (unsigned long long) myepoch,
4033 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent,
4034 server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received
4035 );
4036 addReplySds(c,sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"$%lu\r\n",
4037 (unsigned long)sdslen(info)));
4038 addReplySds(c,info);
4039 addReply(c,shared.crlf);
4040 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"saveconfig") && c->argc == 2) {
4041 int retval = clusterSaveConfig(1);
4042
4043 if (retval == 0)
4044 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4045 else
4046 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"error saving the cluster node config: %s",
4047 strerror(errno));
4048 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"keyslot") && c->argc == 3) {
4049 /* CLUSTER KEYSLOT <key> */
4050 sds key = c->argv[2]->ptr;
4051
4052 addReplyLongLong(c,keyHashSlot(key,sdslen(key)));
4053 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"countkeysinslot") && c->argc == 3) {
4054 /* CLUSTER COUNTKEYSINSLOT <slot> */
4055 long long slot;
4056
4057 if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&slot,NULL) != REDIS_OK)
4058 return;
4059 if (slot < 0 || slot >= REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS) {
4060 addReplyError(c,"Invalid slot");
4061 return;
4062 }
4063 addReplyLongLong(c,countKeysInSlot(slot));
4064 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"getkeysinslot") && c->argc == 4) {
4065 /* CLUSTER GETKEYSINSLOT <slot> <count> */
4066 long long maxkeys, slot;
4067 unsigned int numkeys, j;
4068 robj **keys;
4069
4070 if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&slot,NULL) != REDIS_OK)
4071 return;
4072 if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[3],&maxkeys,NULL)
4073 != REDIS_OK)
4074 return;
4075 if (slot < 0 || slot >= REDIS_CLUSTER_SLOTS || maxkeys < 0) {
4076 addReplyError(c,"Invalid slot or number of keys");
4077 return;
4078 }
4079
4080 keys = zmalloc(sizeof(robj*)*maxkeys);
4081 numkeys = getKeysInSlot(slot, keys, maxkeys);
4082 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,numkeys);
4083 for (j = 0; j < numkeys; j++) addReplyBulk(c,keys[j]);
4084 zfree(keys);
4085 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"forget") && c->argc == 3) {
4086 /* CLUSTER FORGET <NODE ID> */
4087 clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4088
4089 if (!n) {
4090 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4091 return;
4092 } else if (n == myself) {
4093 addReplyError(c,"I tried hard but I can't forget myself...");
4094 return;
4095 } else if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof == n) {
4096 addReplyError(c,"Can't forget my master!");
4097 return;
4098 }
4099 clusterBlacklistAddNode(n);
4100 clusterDelNode(n);
4101 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
4102 CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4103 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4104 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"replicate") && c->argc == 3) {
4105 /* CLUSTER REPLICATE <NODE ID> */
4106 clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4107
4108 /* Lookup the specified node in our table. */
4109 if (!n) {
4110 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4111 return;
4112 }
4113
4114 /* I can't replicate myself. */
4115 if (n == myself) {
4116 addReplyError(c,"Can't replicate myself");
4117 return;
4118 }
4119
4120 /* Can't replicate a slave. */
4121 if (nodeIsSlave(n)) {
4122 addReplyError(c,"I can only replicate a master, not a slave.");
4123 return;
4124 }
4125
4126 /* If the instance is currently a master, it should have no assigned
4127 * slots nor keys to accept to replicate some other node.
4128 * Slaves can switch to another master without issues. */
4129 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
4130 (myself->numslots != 0 || dictSize(server.db[0].dict) != 0)) {
4131 addReplyError(c,
4132 "To set a master the node must be empty and "
4133 "without assigned slots.");
4134 return;
4135 }
4136
4137 /* Set the master. */
4138 clusterSetMaster(n);
4139 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4140 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4141 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slaves") && c->argc == 3) {
4142 /* CLUSTER SLAVES <NODE ID> */
4143 clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4144 int j;
4145
4146 /* Lookup the specified node in our table. */
4147 if (!n) {
4148 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4149 return;
4150 }
4151
4152 if (nodeIsSlave(n)) {
4153 addReplyError(c,"The specified node is not a master");
4154 return;
4155 }
4156
4157 addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,n->numslaves);
4158 for (j = 0; j < n->numslaves; j++) {
4159 sds ni = clusterGenNodeDescription(n->slaves[j]);
4160 addReplyBulkCString(c,ni);
4161 sdsfree(ni);
4162 }
4163 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"count-failure-reports") &&
4164 c->argc == 3)
4165 {
4166 /* CLUSTER COUNT-FAILURE-REPORTS <NODE ID> */
4167 clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4168
4169 if (!n) {
4170 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4171 return;
4172 } else {
4173 addReplyLongLong(c,clusterNodeFailureReportsCount(n));
4174 }
4175 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"failover") &&
4176 (c->argc == 2 || c->argc == 3))
4177 {
4178 /* CLUSTER FAILOVER [FORCE|TAKEOVER] */
4179 int force = 0, takeover = 0;
4180
4181 if (c->argc == 3) {
4182 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"force")) {
4183 force = 1;
4184 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"takeover")) {
4185 takeover = 1;
4186 force = 1; /* Takeover also implies force. */
4187 } else {
4188 addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4189 return;
4190 }
4191 }
4192
4193 /* Check preconditions. */
4194 if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) {
4195 addReplyError(c,"You should send CLUSTER FAILOVER to a slave");
4196 return;
4197 } else if (myself->slaveof == NULL) {
4198 addReplyError(c,"I'm a slave but my master is unknown to me");
4199 return;
4200 } else if (!force &&
4201 (nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) ||
4202 myself->slaveof->link == NULL))
4203 {
4204 addReplyError(c,"Master is down or failed, "
4205 "please use CLUSTER FAILOVER FORCE");
4206 return;
4207 }
4208 resetManualFailover();
4209 server.cluster->mf_end = mstime() + REDIS_CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT;
4210
4211 if (takeover) {
4212 /* A takeover does not perform any initial check. It just
4213 * generates a new configuration epoch for this node without
4214 * consensus, claims the master's slots, and broadcast the new
4215 * configuration. */
4216 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Taking over the master (user request).");
4217 clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus();
4218 clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster();
4219 } else if (force) {
4220 /* If this is a forced failover, we don't need to talk with our
4221 * master to agree about the offset. We just failover taking over
4222 * it without coordination. */
4223 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Forced failover user request accepted.");
4224 server.cluster->mf_can_start = 1;
4225 } else {
4226 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,"Manual failover user request accepted.");
4227 clusterSendMFStart(myself->slaveof);
4228 }
4229 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4230 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"set-config-epoch") && c->argc == 3)
4231 {
4232 /* CLUSTER SET-CONFIG-EPOCH <epoch>
4233 *
4234 * The user is allowed to set the config epoch only when a node is
4235 * totally fresh: no config epoch, no other known node, and so forth.
4236 * This happens at cluster creation time to start with a cluster where
4237 * every node has a different node ID, without to rely on the conflicts
4238 * resolution system which is too slow when a big cluster is created. */
4239 long long epoch;
4240
4241 if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&epoch,NULL) != REDIS_OK)
4242 return;
4243
4244 if (epoch < 0) {
4245 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid config epoch specified: %lld",epoch);
4246 } else if (dictSize(server.cluster->nodes) > 1) {
4247 addReplyError(c,"The user can assign a config epoch only when the "
4248 "node does not know any other node.");
4249 } else if (myself->configEpoch != 0) {
4250 addReplyError(c,"Node config epoch is already non-zero");
4251 } else {
4252 myself->configEpoch = epoch;
