4253 redisLog(REDIS_WARNING,
4254 "configEpoch set to %llu via CLUSTER SET-CONFIG-EPOCH",
4255 (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
4256
4257 if (server.cluster->currentEpoch < (uint64_t)epoch)
4258 server.cluster->currentEpoch = epoch;
4259 /* No need to fsync the config here since in the unlucky event
4260 * of a failure to persist the config, the conflict resolution code
4261 * will assign an unique config to this node. */
4262 clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
4263 CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4264 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4265 }
4266 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"reset") &&
4267 (c->argc == 2 || c->argc == 3))
4268 {
4269 /* CLUSTER RESET [SOFT|HARD] */
4270 int hard = 0;
4271
4272 /* Parse soft/hard argument. Default is soft. */
4273 if (c->argc == 3) {
4274 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"hard")) {
4275 hard = 1;
4276 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"soft")) {
4277 hard = 0;
4278 } else {
4279 addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4280 return;
4281 }
4282 }
4283
4284 /* Slaves can be reset while containing data, but not master nodes
4285 * that must be empty. */
4286 if (nodeIsMaster(myself) && dictSize(c->db->dict) != 0) {
4287 addReplyError(c,"CLUSTER RESET can't be called with "
4288 "master nodes containing keys");
4289 return;
4290 }
4291 clusterReset(hard);
4292 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4293 } else {
4294 addReplyError(c,"Wrong CLUSTER subcommand or number of arguments");
4295 }
4296}
4297
4298/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4299 * DUMP, RESTORE and MIGRATE commands
4300 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4301
4302/* Generates a DUMP-format representation of the object 'o', adding it to the
4303 * io stream pointed by 'rio'. This function can't fail. */
4304void createDumpPayload(rio *payload, robj *o) {
4305 unsigned char buf[2];
4306 uint64_t crc;
4307
4308 /* Serialize the object in a RDB-like format. It consist of an object type
4309 * byte followed by the serialized object. This is understood by RESTORE. */
4310 rioInitWithBuffer(payload,sdsempty());
4311 redisAssert(rdbSaveObjectType(payload,o));
4312 redisAssert(rdbSaveObject(payload,o));
4313
4314 /* Write the footer, this is how it looks like:
4315 * ----------------+---------------------+---------------+
4316 * ... RDB payload | 2 bytes RDB version | 8 bytes CRC64 |
4317 * ----------------+---------------------+---------------+
4318 * RDB version and CRC are both in little endian.
4319 */
4320
4321 /* RDB version */
4322 buf[0] = REDIS_RDB_VERSION & 0xff;
4323 buf[1] = (REDIS_RDB_VERSION >> 8) & 0xff;
4324 payload->io.buffer.ptr = sdscatlen(payload->io.buffer.ptr,buf,2);
4325
4326 /* CRC64 */
4327 crc = crc64(0,(unsigned char*)payload->io.buffer.ptr,
4328 sdslen(payload->io.buffer.ptr));
4329 memrev64ifbe(&crc);
4330 payload->io.buffer.ptr = sdscatlen(payload->io.buffer.ptr,&crc,8);
4331}
4332
4333/* Verify that the RDB version of the dump payload matches the one of this Redis
4334 * instance and that the checksum is ok.
4335 * If the DUMP payload looks valid REDIS_OK is returned, otherwise REDIS_ERR
4336 * is returned. */
4337int verifyDumpPayload(unsigned char *p, size_t len) {
4338 unsigned char *footer;
4339 uint16_t rdbver;
4340 uint64_t crc;
4341
4342 /* At least 2 bytes of RDB version and 8 of CRC64 should be present. */
4343 if (len < 10) return REDIS_ERR;
4344 footer = p+(len-10);
4345
4346 /* Verify RDB version */
4347 rdbver = (footer[1] << 8) | footer[0];
4348 if (rdbver != REDIS_RDB_VERSION) return REDIS_ERR;
4349
4350 /* Verify CRC64 */
4351 crc = crc64(0,p,len-8);
4352 memrev64ifbe(&crc);
4353 return (memcmp(&crc,footer+2,8) == 0) ? REDIS_OK : REDIS_ERR;
4354}
4355
4356/* DUMP keyname
4357 * DUMP is actually not used by Redis Cluster but it is the obvious
4358 * complement of RESTORE and can be useful for different applications. */
4359void dumpCommand(redisClient *c) {
4360 robj *o, *dumpobj;
4361 rio payload;
4362
4363 /* Check if the key is here. */
4364 if ((o = lookupKeyRead(c->db,c->argv[1])) == NULL) {
4365 addReply(c,shared.nullbulk);
4366 return;
4367 }
4368
4369 /* Create the DUMP encoded representation. */
4370 createDumpPayload(&payload,o);
4371
4372 /* Transfer to the client */
4373 dumpobj = createObject(REDIS_STRING,payload.io.buffer.ptr);
4374 addReplyBulk(c,dumpobj);
4375 decrRefCount(dumpobj);
4376 return;
4377}
4378
4379/* RESTORE key ttl serialized-value [REPLACE] */
4380void restoreCommand(redisClient *c) {
4381 long long ttl;
4382 rio payload;
4383 int j, type, replace = 0;
4384 robj *obj;
4385
4386 /* Parse additional options */
4387 for (j = 4; j < c->argc; j++) {
4388 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"replace")) {
4389 replace = 1;
4390 } else {
4391 addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4392 return;
4393 }
4394 }
4395
4396 /* Make sure this key does not already exist here... */
4397 if (!replace && lookupKeyWrite(c->db,c->argv[1]) != NULL) {
4398 addReply(c,shared.busykeyerr);
4399 return;
4400 }
4401
4402 /* Check if the TTL value makes sense */
4403 if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&ttl,NULL) != REDIS_OK) {
4404 return;
4405 } else if (ttl < 0) {
4406 addReplyError(c,"Invalid TTL value, must be >= 0");
4407 return;
4408 }
4409
4410 /* Verify RDB version and data checksum. */
4411 if (verifyDumpPayload(c->argv[3]->ptr,sdslen(c->argv[3]->ptr)) == REDIS_ERR)
4412 {
4413 addReplyError(c,"DUMP payload version or checksum are wrong");
4414 return;
4415 }
4416
4417 rioInitWithBuffer(&payload,c->argv[3]->ptr);
4418 if (((type = rdbLoadObjectType(&payload)) == -1) ||
4419 ((obj = rdbLoadObject(type,&payload)) == NULL))
4420 {
4421 addReplyError(c,"Bad data format");
4422 return;
4423 }
4424
4425 /* Remove the old key if needed. */
4426 if (replace) dbDelete(c->db,c->argv[1]);
4427
4428 /* Create the key and set the TTL if any */
4429 dbAdd(c->db,c->argv[1],obj);
4430 if (ttl) setExpire(c->db,c->argv[1],mstime()+ttl);
4431 signalModifiedKey(c->db,c->argv[1]);
4432 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4433 server.dirty++;
4434}
4435
4436/* MIGRATE socket cache implementation.
4437 *
4438 * We take a map between host:ip and a TCP socket that we used to connect
4439 * to this instance in recent time.
4440 * This sockets are closed when the max number we cache is reached, and also
4441 * in serverCron() when they are around for more than a few seconds. */
4442#define MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_ITEMS 64 /* max num of items in the cache. */
4443#define MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_TTL 10 /* close cached sockets after 10 sec. */
4444
4445typedef struct migrateCachedSocket {
4446 int fd;
4447 long last_dbid;
4448 time_t last_use_time;
4449} migrateCachedSocket;
4450
4451/* Return a migrateCachedSocket containing a TCP socket connected with the
4452 * target instance, possibly returning a cached one.
4453 *
4454 * This function is responsible of sending errors to the client if a
4455 * connection can't be established. In this case -1 is returned.
4456 * Otherwise on success the socket is returned, and the caller should not
4457 * attempt to free it after usage.
4458 *
4459 * If the caller detects an error while using the socket, migrateCloseSocket()
4460 * should be called so that the connection will be created from scratch
4461 * the next time. */
4462migrateCachedSocket* migrateGetSocket(redisClient *c, robj *host, robj *port, long timeout) {
4463 int fd;
4464 sds name = sdsempty();
4465 migrateCachedSocket *cs;
4466
4467 /* Check if we have an already cached socket for this ip:port pair. */
4468 name = sdscatlen(name,host->ptr,sdslen(host->ptr));
4469 name = sdscatlen(name,":",1);
4470 name = sdscatlen(name,port->ptr,sdslen(port->ptr));
4471 cs = dictFetchValue(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
4472 if (cs) {
4473 sdsfree(name);
4474 cs->last_use_time = server.unixtime;
4475 return cs;
4476 }
4477
4478 /* No cached socket, create one. */
4479 if (dictSize(server.migrate_cached_sockets) == MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_ITEMS) {
4480 /* Too many items, drop one at random. */
4481 dictEntry *de = dictGetRandomKey(server.migrate_cached_sockets);
4482 cs = dictGetVal(de);
4483 close(cs->fd);
4484 zfree(cs);
4485 dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,dictGetKey(de));
4486 }
4487
4488 /* Create the socket */
4489 fd = anetTcpNonBlockBindConnect(server.neterr,c->argv[1]->ptr,
4490 atoi(c->argv[2]->ptr),REDIS_BIND_ADDR);
4491 if (fd == -1) {
4492 sdsfree(name);
4493 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Can't connect to target node: %s",
4494 server.neterr);
4495 return NULL;
4496 }
4497 anetEnableTcpNoDelay(server.neterr,fd);
4498
4499 /* Check if it connects within the specified timeout. */
4500 if ((aeWait(fd,AE_WRITABLE,timeout) & AE_WRITABLE) == 0) {
4501 sdsfree(name);
4502 addReplySds(c,
4503 sdsnew("-IOERR error or timeout connecting to the client\r\n"));
4504 close(fd);
4505 return NULL;
4506 }
4507
4508 /* Add to the cache and return it to the caller. */
4509 cs = zmalloc(sizeof(*cs));
4510 cs->fd = fd;
4511 cs->last_dbid = -1;
4512 cs->last_use_time = server.unixtime;
4513 dictAdd(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name,cs);
4514 return cs;
4515}
4516
4517/* Free a migrate cached connection. */
4518void migrateCloseSocket(robj *host, robj *port) {
4519 sds name = sdsempty();
4520 migrateCachedSocket *cs;
4521
4522 name = sdscatlen(name,host->ptr,sdslen(host->ptr));
4523 name = sdscatlen(name,":",1);
4524 name = sdscatlen(name,port->ptr,sdslen(port->ptr));
4525 cs = dictFetchValue(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
4526 if (!cs) {
4527 sdsfree(name);
4528 return;
4529 }
4530
4531 close(cs->fd);
4532 zfree(cs);
4533 dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
4534 sdsfree(name);
4535}
4536
4537void migrateCloseTimedoutSockets(void) {
4538 dictIterator *di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.migrate_cached_sockets);
4539 dictEntry *de;
4540
4541 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4542 migrateCachedSocket *cs = dictGetVal(de);
4543
4544 if ((server.unixtime - cs->last_use_time) > MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_TTL) {
4545 close(cs->fd);
4546 zfree(cs);
4547 dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,dictGetKey(de));
4548 }
4549 }
4550 dictReleaseIterator(di);
4551}
4552
4553/* MIGRATE host port key dbid timeout [COPY | REPLACE] */
4554void migrateCommand(redisClient *c) {
4555 migrateCachedSocket *cs;
4556 int copy, replace, j;
4557 long timeout;
4558 long dbid;
4559 long long ttl, expireat;
4560 robj *o;
4561 rio cmd, payload;
4562 int retry_num = 0;
4563
4564try_again:
4565 /* Initialization */
4566 copy = 0;
4567 replace = 0;
4568 ttl = 0;
4569
4570 /* Parse additional options */
4571 for (j = 6; j < c->argc; j++) {
4572 if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"copy")) {
4573 copy = 1;
4574 } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"replace")) {
4575 replace = 1;
4576 } else {
4577 addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4578 return;
4579 }
4580 }
4581
4582 /* Sanity check */
4583 if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[5],&timeout,NULL) != REDIS_OK)
4584 return;
4585 if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&dbid,NULL) != REDIS_OK)
4586 return;
4587 if (timeout <= 0) timeout = 1000;
4588
4589 /* Check if the key is here. If not we reply with success as there is
4590 * nothing to migrate (for instance the key expired in the meantime), but
4591 * we include such information in the reply string. */
4592 if ((o = lookupKeyRead(c->db,c->argv[3])) == NULL) {
4593 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("+NOKEY\r\n"));
4594 return;
4595 }
4596
4597 /* Connect */
4598 cs = migrateGetSocket(c,c->argv[1],c->argv[2],timeout);
4599 if (cs == NULL) return; /* error sent to the client by migrateGetSocket() */
4600
4601 rioInitWithBuffer(&cmd,sdsempty());
4602
4603 /* Send the SELECT command if the current DB is not already selected. */
4604 int select = cs->last_dbid != dbid; /* Should we emit SELECT? */
4605 if (select) {
4606 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkCount(&cmd,'*',2));
4607 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"SELECT",6));
4608 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkLongLong(&cmd,dbid));
4609 }
4610
4611 /* Create RESTORE payload and generate the protocol to call the command. */
4612 expireat = getExpire(c->db,c->argv[3]);
4613 if (expireat != -1) {
4614 ttl = expireat-mstime();
4615 if (ttl < 1) ttl = 1;
4616 }
4617 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkCount(&cmd,'*',replace ? 5 : 4));
4618 if (server.cluster_enabled)
4619 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,
4620 rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"RESTORE-ASKING",14));
4621 else
4622 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"RESTORE",7));
4623 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,sdsEncodedObject(c->argv[3]));
4624 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,c->argv[3]->ptr,
4625 sdslen(c->argv[3]->ptr)));
4626 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkLongLong(&cmd,ttl));
4627
4628 /* Emit the payload argument, that is the serialized object using
4629 * the DUMP format. */
4630 createDumpPayload(&payload,o);
4631 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,payload.io.buffer.ptr,
4632 sdslen(payload.io.buffer.ptr)));
4633 sdsfree(payload.io.buffer.ptr);
4634
4635 /* Add the REPLACE option to the RESTORE command if it was specified
4636 * as a MIGRATE option. */
4637 if (replace)
4638 redisAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"REPLACE",7));
4639
4640 /* Transfer the query to the other node in 64K chunks. */
4641 errno = 0;
4642 {
4643 sds buf = cmd.io.buffer.ptr;
4644 size_t pos = 0, towrite;
4645 int nwritten = 0;
4646
4647 while ((towrite = sdslen(buf)-pos) > 0) {
4648 towrite = (towrite > (64*1024) ? (64*1024) : towrite);
4649 nwritten = syncWrite(cs->fd,buf+pos,towrite,timeout);
4650 if (nwritten != (signed)towrite) goto socket_wr_err;
4651 pos += nwritten;
4652 }
4653 }
4654
4655 /* Read back the reply. */
4656 {
4657 char buf1[1024];
4658 char buf2[1024];
4659
4660 /* Read the two replies */
4661 if (select && syncReadLine(cs->fd, buf1, sizeof(buf1), timeout) <= 0)
4662 goto socket_rd_err;
4663 if (syncReadLine(cs->fd, buf2, sizeof(buf2), timeout) <= 0)
4664 goto socket_rd_err;
4665 if ((select && buf1[0] == '-') || buf2[0] == '-') {
4666 /* On error assume that last_dbid is no longer valid. */
4667 cs->last_dbid = -1;
4668 addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Target instance replied with error: %s",
4669 (select && buf1[0] == '-') ? buf1+1 : buf2+1);
4670 } else {
4671 /* Update the last_dbid in migrateCachedSocket */
4672 cs->last_dbid = dbid;
4673 robj *aux;
4674
4675 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4676
4677 if (!copy) {
4678 /* No COPY option: remove the local key, signal the change. */
4679 dbDelete(c->db,c->argv[3]);
4680 signalModifiedKey(c->db,c->argv[3]);
4681 server.dirty++;
4682
4683 /* Translate MIGRATE as DEL for replication/AOF. */
4684 aux = createStringObject("DEL",3);
4685 rewriteClientCommandVector(c,2,aux,c->argv[3]);
4686 decrRefCount(aux);
4687 }
4688 }
4689 }
4690
4691 sdsfree(cmd.io.buffer.ptr);
4692 return;
4693
4694socket_wr_err:
4695 sdsfree(cmd.io.buffer.ptr);
4696 migrateCloseSocket(c->argv[1],c->argv[2]);
4697 if (errno != ETIMEDOUT && retry_num++ == 0) goto try_again;
4698 addReplySds(c,
4699 sdsnew("-IOERR error or timeout writing to target instance\r\n"));
4700 return;
4701
4702socket_rd_err:
4703 sdsfree(cmd.io.buffer.ptr);
4704 migrateCloseSocket(c->argv[1],c->argv[2]);
4705 if (errno != ETIMEDOUT && retry_num++ == 0) goto try_again;
4706 addReplySds(c,
4707 sdsnew("-IOERR error or timeout reading from target node\r\n"));
4708 return;
4709}
4710
4711/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4712 * Cluster functions related to serving / redirecting clients
4713 * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4714
4715/* The ASKING command is required after a -ASK redirection.
4716 * The client should issue ASKING before to actually send the command to
4717 * the target instance. See the Redis Cluster specification for more
4718 * information. */
4719void askingCommand(redisClient *c) {
4720 if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
4721 addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
4722 return;
4723 }
4724 c->flags |= REDIS_ASKING;
4725 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4726}
4727
4728/* The READONLY command is used by clients to enter the read-only mode.
4729 * In this mode slaves will not redirect clients as long as clients access
4730 * with read-only commands to keys that are served by the slave's master. */
4731void readonlyCommand(redisClient *c) {
4732 if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
4733 addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
4734 return;
4735 }
4736 c->flags |= REDIS_READONLY;
4737 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4738}
4739
4740/* The READWRITE command just clears the READONLY command state. */
4741void readwriteCommand(redisClient *c) {
4742 c->flags &= ~REDIS_READONLY;
4743 addReply(c,shared.ok);
4744}
4745
4746/* Return the pointer to the cluster node that is able to serve the command.
4747 * For the function to succeed the command should only target either:
4748 *
4749 * 1) A single key (even multiple times like LPOPRPUSH mylist mylist).
4750 * 2) Multiple keys in the same hash slot, while the slot is stable (no
4751 * resharding in progress).
4752 *
4753 * On success the function returns the node that is able to serve the request.
4754 * If the node is not 'myself' a redirection must be perfomed. The kind of
4755 * redirection is specified setting the integer passed by reference
4756 * 'error_code', which will be set to REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK or
4757 * REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED.
4758 *
4759 * When the node is 'myself' 'error_code' is set to REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_NONE.
4760 *
4761 * If the command fails NULL is returned, and the reason of the failure is
4762 * provided via 'error_code', which will be set to:
4763 *
4764 * REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT if the request contains multiple keys that
4765 * don't belong to the same hash slot.
4766 *
4767 * REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE if the request contains mutliple keys
4768 * belonging to the same slot, but the slot is not stable (in migration or
4769 * importing state, likely because a resharding is in progress).
4770 *
4771 * REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND if the request addresses a slot which is
4772 * not bound to any node. In this case the cluster global state should be
4773 * already "down" but it is fragile to rely on the update of the global state,
4774 * so we also handle it here. */
4775clusterNode *getNodeByQuery(redisClient *c, struct redisCommand *cmd, robj **argv, int argc, int *hashslot, int *error_code) {
4776 clusterNode *n = NULL;
4777 robj *firstkey = NULL;
4778 int multiple_keys = 0;
4779 multiState *ms, _ms;
4780 multiCmd mc;
4781 int i, slot = 0, migrating_slot = 0, importing_slot = 0, missing_keys = 0;
4782
4783 /* Set error code optimistically for the base case. */
4784 if (error_code) *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_NONE;
4785
4786 /* We handle all the cases as if they were EXEC commands, so we have
4787 * a common code path for everything */
4788 if (cmd->proc == execCommand) {
4789 /* If REDIS_MULTI flag is not set EXEC is just going to return an
4790 * error. */
4791 if (!(c->flags & REDIS_MULTI)) return myself;
4792 ms = &c->mstate;
4793 } else {
4794 /* In order to have a single codepath create a fake Multi State
4795 * structure if the client is not in MULTI/EXEC state, this way
4796 * we have a single codepath below. */
4797 ms = &_ms;
4798 _ms.commands = &mc;
4799 _ms.count = 1;
4800 mc.argv = argv;
4801 mc.argc = argc;
4802 mc.cmd = cmd;
4803 }
4804
4805 /* Check that all the keys are in the same hash slot, and obtain this
4806 * slot and the node associated. */
4807 for (i = 0; i < ms->count; i++) {
4808 struct redisCommand *mcmd;
4809 robj **margv;
4810 int margc, *keyindex, numkeys, j;
4811
4812 mcmd = ms->commands[i].cmd;
4813 margc = ms->commands[i].argc;
4814 margv = ms->commands[i].argv;
4815
4816 keyindex = getKeysFromCommand(mcmd,margv,margc,&numkeys);
4817 for (j = 0; j < numkeys; j++) {
4818 robj *thiskey = margv[keyindex[j]];
4819 int thisslot = keyHashSlot((char*)thiskey->ptr,
4820 sdslen(thiskey->ptr));
4821
4822 if (firstkey == NULL) {
4823 /* This is the first key we see. Check what is the slot
4824 * and node. */
4825 firstkey = thiskey;
4826 slot = thisslot;
4827 n = server.cluster->slots[slot];
4828
4829 /* Error: If a slot is not served, we are in "cluster down"
4830 * state. However the state is yet to be updated, so this was
4831 * not trapped earlier in processCommand(). Report the same
4832 * error to the client. */
4833 if (n == NULL) {
4834 getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
4835 if (error_code)
4836 *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND;
4837 return NULL;
4838 }
4839
4840 /* If we are migrating or importing this slot, we need to check
4841 * if we have all the keys in the request (the only way we
4842 * can safely serve the request, otherwise we return a TRYAGAIN
4843 * error). To do so we set the importing/migrating state and
4844 * increment a counter for every missing key. */
4845 if (n == myself &&
4846 server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] != NULL)
4847 {
4848 migrating_slot = 1;
4849 } else if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] != NULL) {
4850 importing_slot = 1;
4851 }
4852 } else {
4853 /* If it is not the first key, make sure it is exactly
4854 * the same key as the first we saw. */
4855 if (!equalStringObjects(firstkey,thiskey)) {
4856 if (slot != thisslot) {
4857 /* Error: multiple keys from different slots. */
4858 getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
4859 if (error_code)
4860 *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT;
4861 return NULL;
4862 } else {
4863 /* Flag this request as one with multiple different
4864 * keys. */
4865 multiple_keys = 1;
4866 }
4867 }
4868 }
4869
4870 /* Migarting / Improrting slot? Count keys we don't have. */
4871 if ((migrating_slot || importing_slot) &&
4872 lookupKeyRead(&server.db[0],thiskey) == NULL)
4873 {
4874 missing_keys++;
4875 }
4876 }
4877 getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
4878 }
4879
4880 /* No key at all in command? then we can serve the request
4881 * without redirections or errors. */
4882 if (n == NULL) return myself;
4883
4884 /* Return the hashslot by reference. */
4885 if (hashslot) *hashslot = slot;
4886
4887 /* This request is about a slot we are migrating into another instance?
4888 * Then if we have all the keys. */
4889
4890 /* If we don't have all the keys and we are migrating the slot, send
4891 * an ASK redirection. */
4892 if (migrating_slot && missing_keys) {
4893 if (error_code) *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK;
4894 return server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot];
4895 }
4896
4897 /* If we are receiving the slot, and the client correctly flagged the
4898 * request as "ASKING", we can serve the request. However if the request
4899 * involves multiple keys and we don't have them all, the only option is
4900 * to send a TRYAGAIN error. */
4901 if (importing_slot &&
4902 (c->flags & REDIS_ASKING || cmd->flags & REDIS_CMD_ASKING))
4903 {
4904 if (multiple_keys && missing_keys) {
4905 if (error_code) *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE;
4906 return NULL;
4907 } else {
4908 return myself;
4909 }
4910 }
4911
4912 /* Handle the read-only client case reading from a slave: if this
4913 * node is a slave and the request is about an hash slot our master
4914 * is serving, we can reply without redirection. */
4915 if (c->flags & REDIS_READONLY &&
4916 cmd->flags & REDIS_CMD_READONLY &&
4917 nodeIsSlave(myself) &&
4918 myself->slaveof == n)
4919 {
4920 return myself;
4921 }
4922
4923 /* Base case: just return the right node. However if this node is not
4924 * myself, set error_code to MOVED since we need to issue a rediretion. */
4925 if (n != myself && error_code) *error_code = REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED;
4926 return n;
4927}
4928
4929/* Send the client the right redirection code, according to error_code
4930 * that should be set to one of REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_* macros.
4931 *
4932 * If REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK or REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED error codes
4933 * are used, then the node 'n' should not be NULL, but should be the
4934 * node we want to mention in the redirection. Moreover hashslot should
4935 * be set to the hash slot that caused the redirection. */
4936void clusterRedirectClient(redisClient *c, clusterNode *n, int hashslot, int error_code) {
4937 if (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT) {
4938 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CROSSSLOT Keys in request don't hash to the same slot\r\n"));
4939 } else if (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE) {
4940 /* The request spawns mutliple keys in the same slot,
4941 * but the slot is not "stable" currently as there is
4942 * a migration or import in progress. */
4943 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-TRYAGAIN Multiple keys request during rehashing of slot\r\n"));
4944 } else if (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE) {
4945 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CLUSTERDOWN The cluster is down\r\n"));
4946 } else if (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND) {
4947 addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CLUSTERDOWN Hash slot not served\r\n"));
4948 } else if (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED ||
4949 error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK)
4950 {
4951 addReplySds(c,sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
4952 "-%s %d %s:%d\r\n",
4953 (error_code == REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK) ? "ASK" : "MOVED",
4954 hashslot,n->ip,n->port));
4955 } else {
4956 redisPanic("getNodeByQuery() unknown error.");
4957 }
4958}
4959
4960/* This function is called by the function processing clients incrementally
4961 * to detect timeouts, in order to handle the following case:
4962 *
4963 * 1) A client blocks with BLPOP or similar blocking operation.
4964 * 2) The master migrates the hash slot elsewhere or turns into a slave.
4965 * 3) The client may remain blocked forever (or up to the max timeout time)
4966 * waiting for a key change that will never happen.
4967 *
4968 * If the client is found to be blocked into an hash slot this node no
4969 * longer handles, the client is sent a redirection error, and the function
4970 * returns 1. Otherwise 0 is returned and no operation is performed. */
4971int clusterRedirectBlockedClientIfNeeded(redisClient *c) {
4972 if (c->flags & REDIS_BLOCKED && c->btype == REDIS_BLOCKED_LIST) {
4973 dictEntry *de;
4974 dictIterator *di;
4975
4976 /* If the cluster is down, unblock the client with the right error. */
4977 if (server.cluster->state == REDIS_CLUSTER_FAIL) {
4978 clusterRedirectClient(c,NULL,0,REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE);
4979 return 1;
4980 }
4981
4982 di = dictGetIterator(c->bpop.keys);
4983 while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4984 robj *key = dictGetKey(de);
4985 int slot = keyHashSlot((char*)key->ptr, sdslen(key->ptr));
4986 clusterNode *node = server.cluster->slots[slot];
4987
4988 /* We send an error and unblock the client if:
4989 * 1) The slot is unassigned, emitting a cluster down error.
4990 * 2) The slot is not handled by this node, nor being imported. */
4991 if (node != myself &&
4992 server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] == NULL)
4993 {
4994 if (node == NULL) {
4995 clusterRedirectClient(c,NULL,0,
4996 REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND);
4997 } else {
4998 clusterRedirectClient(c,node,slot,
4999 REDIS_CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED);
5000 }
5001 return 1;
5002 }
5003 }
5004 dictReleaseIterator(di);
5005 }
5006 return 0;
5007}
